However, the potential benefits you cite will not occur automatically. There are difficult technical, institutional and environmental issues that must be resolved if resource recovery is to be a boon to the city.

title: News Summary
description: President Carter disclosed in India that he and Prime Minister Morarji R. Desai had disagreed sharply over United States demands that India accept safeguards aimed at insuring the peaceful use of Americansupplied nuclear fuel for Indian power reactors. Nevertheless, in a speech to the Indian Parliament, Mr. Carter said that shipments of nuclear fuel would be made to India under longstanding commitments. [Page 1, Column 6.]

title: Allentown, Pa., Gets New Mayor
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., Jan. 2 (UPI)Frank Fischl, a Republican, was sworn in today as Mayor of Allentown, a post he won by only 121 votes in a hotly disuted race last November. He defeated Joseph Daddona. a Democrat who was the incumbent. Also today, the form of county government in Lehigh and Northhampton Counties changed. New nineman councils were sworn in at Allentown and Easton to replace the old threeman county commissions.

title: The Freshman
description: Last March, when asked on a callin radio program about the burdens of his new office, Jimmy Carter answered with nonchalance, naivet and perhaps a certain arrogance: I would say that the number of hours I put in and the difficulty of the job is about the same as it was when I was Governor of Georgia, but in addition, it is more interesting because you have the foreign affairs questions to address. The education of the President has come a long way. When he was asked a similar question in a yearend television interview last week, he readily conceded that he has moments when I'm not sure that I can deal with problems satisfactorily. And he repeatedly used phrases like I'm learning, my newness and my biggest mistake. The modesty is becoming. It has been a rocky year for the man who ran against Washington and then found that he had to try to master it.

title: COMPROMISE IS SEEN BY U.S. ON WEST BANK
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2United States officials have detected the outline of a possible compromise between Israel and Egypt over the Palestinian issue despite the publicized differences between Prime Minister Menahem Begin and President Anwar elSadat.

title: Pennsylvania Mirror Ceases
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa., Jan. 2 (UPI)The Pennsylvania Mirror, a morning newspaper serving the Centre County area, ceased publication over the weekend after nine years of operation. The newspaper, which had a circulation of 8,000, cited increased costs of production for the decision. State College will continue to be served by the Centre County Times, an afternoon newspaper with circulation of 18,000.

title: Communists Win in Indian State
description: NEWDELHI, Jan. 2 (Reuters)India's Marxist Communist Party today won a sweeping victory in assembly elections in the northeastern state of Tripura. With the results of 48 of the 60 seats counted thus far, the Marxists won 40. The party has stressed its ideological independence of both Moscow and Peking. The Marxists came to, power in the state of West Bengal last. June.

title: 8 Killed in African Miners Fight
description: WINDHOEK, SouthWest Africa, Jan. 2 (Reuters)Three persons were killed and eight wounded in fighting that began after an argument among black miners at Tsumeb, in the north of SouthWest Africa, the police reported today. The police said the trouble started when one miner was stabbed to death in an argument yesterday. The incident resulted in a second fight last night in which twc other men were killed.

title: Bad Weather Prevents Departure. Of Banned Editor From Lesotho
description: MASERU, Lesotho, Jan. 2 (AP)Bad weather in Botswana prevented Donald Woods, the banned South African editor who fled here last week with his family, from leaving here today. Their departure was rescheduled for tomorrow afternoon.

title: Colorado Doctor Says Hitchhiker Fits Description of a Jail Escapee
description: GLENWOOD SPRINGS, Cola, Jan. 2 (UPI)A doctor said today that a hitchhiker he helped near Thompson. Utah, fit the description of Theodore Bundy, convicted kidnapper and accused murderer who escaped from jail by dieting until he could slip through whole in the ceiling of his cell.

title: On the Need for SelfRestraint
description: WASHINGTONSALT II, the current round of the Strategic Arms Limitation Talks, will neither solve our strategic problems nor end the arms race. We should support SALT, but we must look beyond it. Our choice is not between deals with the Russians or arms expansion; we might get both. The real choice is between unilateral selfrestraint and a new kind of arms competitionthe counterforce race.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3A borderconflict between Cambodia and Vietnam has reached a temporary stalemate, with Vietnamese forces occupying as much as 400 square miles of Cambodian territory following an offensive last month, United States Government officials said today.

title: CARTER ACTS TO END CIVIL SERVICE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3  :President Carter plans to send proposed legislation to Congress next month to abolish the 95yearold Civil Service Commission and replace it with two agencies, one of them independent of the White House.

title: Moscow Six Romps
description: DETROIT, Jan. 3 (AP)Pyotr Prirodin scored four goals tonight as Moscow's Dynamo team trounced the University of Michigan, 120, in an exhibition hockey match at Olympia Stadium. It was the Soviet team's fifth victory on its United States tour, against one loss.

title: HOffman Scheduled To Be Chief Deputy To New Police Head
description: Robert J. McGuire, the city's new Police Commissioner, is scheduled today to name Joseph C. Hoffman, a recently retired deputy chief, as the first deputy police commissioner.

title: WingsCanadiens Put Off
description: DETROITJan. 3 (AP)The Detroit Red Wings and the Montreal Canadiens of the National Hockey League have postponed their game scheduled for Saturday night, the Red Wings announced today. The club said Montreal requested the postponment because mould have no other occasion to play either the touring Soviet or Czechoslovak teams. No makeup date was announced.

title: Q & A
description: Q Many years ago, when I was a child, my family doctor used asafetida in some of his ministrations. They were most foul smelling. Someone has told me asafetida is sometimes used in the kitchen. Could that be true?.

title: U.N. Food Agency Says Few Gains Have Been Made Against Hunger
description: ROME, Jan. 3 (Reuters)The world's major food agency has just completed lengthy selfexamination and come up with a gloomy conclusion on the way its war against hunger is going.

title: Sale of Nassau Coliseum To Garden Is Proposed
description: MINEOLA, L.l., Jan. 3The possible sale of the financially troubled Nassau County Veterans Memorial Coliseum in Uniondale, L.I., to Madison Square Garden Inc., was proposed today by Nassau County Executive Francis T. Purcell as one of a number of ways of shifting the management of the. Coliseum to private hands.

title: Fire Kills Three Children and Man
description: BESSEMER, Ala., Jan. 3 (UPI)Three small children and an elderly man died early today in a blaze, possibly set by an arsonist, that raced through an apartment building as other residents who escaped into the nighttime cold screamed forthe lives of their children. The victims were identified as Tammy Smith, 1 year old Phillip Smith, 2, their halfsister, Michelle Larkin, 2 months, and Thomas Grammer, 7S.

description: For periods ended NOv. 30 unless otherwise indicated. (N) Indicates stock Is traded on The New York Stock Ex. changer (A) American Stock Exchange) and (0) overthecounter.

title: 21 Die in Bus Crash Near Manila
description: MANILA, Jan. 3 (Reuters A Manilabound bus crashed into a parked truck last night at Sariaya, about 50 miles east of the capital, last killing 21 passengers and injuring 38, the police reported.

title: CITY DOES NOT NEED U.S. LOANS, PROXMIRE AND BROOKE CONTEND
description: The chairman and the senior _minority member of theSenate Banking Committee have told President Carter that New York City should not need or get any additional Federal loans after the current seasonal loan program expires on June 30.

title: Wyoming Bishop Resigns
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3 (AP)Pope Paul VI has accepted the resignation of Bishop Hubert Newell of Cheyenne, Wyo. Archbishop Jean Jadot, Apostolic Delegate to the United States, announced today. Bisliop Newell, who is 73 years old, is resigning because of age and ill, health. He will serve as administrator In Cheyenne until a successor is named, the announcement said:

title: Pickets Close Mines in Tennessee; Violence Breaks Out in 3 States
description: Violence erupted in coal country in Indiana, Kentucky and Virginia yesterday, and roving pickets from the United Mine Workers union closed more than a dozen nonU.M.W. mines in Tennessee in the 29th day of a nationwide strike.

title: Technology
description: The mechanical revolution in cotton harvesting continues today, 50 years after it was sparked by the commercialization of one major type of cottonpicking machine, called the stripper, and the invention of moistened spindles that proved crucial for the other =for type. called the spindle picker.

title: College Teachers Course to Stress Contribution of Rabbinic Judaism
description: While it is customary for college history students to delve into Greek and Roman realmsof late antiquity, rarely does the instruction touch upon the period of rabbinic Judaism that flourished from the third century B.C. to the third century A.D.

description: A legislative body meeting to discuss public business May not bar the public or the press, the Appellate Division of New York State's Second Judicial Department ruled yesterday.

description: MANILA, Jan. 3(AP)A fire in a Buddhist temple near Manila's Chinatown killed at least 11 worshipers today, authorities said.

title: Corporation Affairs Schroder Starts Its Capital Expansion Plan
description: The Schroder Group said yesterday that it had completed the first stage oof a $44 million capital expansion program designed to double the capital base of its United States banking subsidiaries, 3. Henry. Schroder Banking Corporation and the Schroder Trust Company, which have been merged to form the 3. Henry Schroder Bank and Trust Company.

title: BILL ON HOMOSEXUALS IS PLANNED IN COUNCIL
description: New legislation to prohibit discrimination against homosexuals in employment, housing and public accommodations will be introduced soon in the New York City Council. In the last seven years, similar biils nave been defeated fiye times in committee and once by, the full Council. The principal opponents have been representatives of the Roman1Catholic Church', Orthodox Jewish groups and the. unions representing police officers and, firemen.

title: Notre Dame Unanimous Choice As Nation's No.1 College Team
description: Notre Dame was elected the National Collegiate football champion by each of the four prominent selection groups yesterday, just 24 hours after the Fighting Irish shattered the University of Texas's dreams for the national title.

title: U.S. Jury Set Up for Investigation Of Alleged Corruption in Stamford
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Jan. 3A special Federal grand jury will begin next month to hear evidence of extensive municipal corruption in this city and in the general Fairfield County area, it was announced today.

title: pooks: The Sixties Tells where We Were
description: ANYONE wanting to know where he was during the 1960's is advised to get hold of The Sixties, an elephantine paperback about the size of Rolling Stone; which, as it happens, published the book. Edited by Lynda Rosen Obst, now a senior editor of The New York Times Magazine, The Sixties is an oral history of the decade, arraged chronologically, and featuring the famous, and formerly famous, and the historical walkons, who strutted their brief hour on the public stage, then were heard no more. Or else went straight or went to Congress or went underground, as in the case of Abbie Hoffman, the most famous missing person since Judge Crater.

title: Notes on People
description: The first black elected to the Boston School Committee since 1899 was sworn into office New Year's Day by a, black judge. The School Committee is the equivalent of a board of education else where. John D. O'Bryant, 46 years old, was sworn into office by. Municipal Court Judge Harry J. Elam at ceremonies in a predominantly black neighbor. hood, Grove Hall. Mr. O'Bryant declined to join the swearingin ceremonies for other new School. Committee members.

title: College Football Polling Is an Inexact Science
description: The ways of determining the country's No. 1 college football team are as different as apples are from oranges, often no more scientific than picking fruit off a tree branch.

title: ExBeame Aide Files $17,000 Claim
description: An official who left his $43,216ayear city job for a 550,000 job with the Health and Hospitals Corporation has filed claim for what he says is accumulated overtime pay in the city posta total of $17.000.

title: Suspect in Oneonta Is Said to Admit Murdei
description: The 26yearold suspect in the slaying of Linda Velzy, an 18yearold Oneonta State College student, has admitted to the murder, law enforcement officials have reported.

title: John Wharton Tribute MOnday.
description: A memorial tribute to John F. Wharton, the theatrical lawyer, will be held Monday at 5 P.M. at the music Box. Theater. Scheduled to speak are Arthur Miller, Lucia Chase, Norman Cousins, Gerald Schoenfeld and Lloyd. Garrison. Mr. Wharton, who died on Thanksgiving Day at the age of 83, helped form the Playwrights Producing Company, a group that included Robert E. Sherwood, Maxwell Anderson, S. N. Behrman, Elmer Rice, Sidney Howard and Robert Anderson. He was a founding member of the law firm of Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison. Warren. Caro of the Shubert Organization will presider

description: Norm/ Nixon and Lou Hudson, the young and the old of the Los Angeles Lakers, put an end to the Knicks dream of a fivegame winning streak last night.

title: Letters
description: To THE LIVING SECTION: I was privileged to see the three plays at the Louisville Actors Theater reviewed favorably by Richard Eder ['Louisville Festival Offers 6 New Plays, Nov. 16]. I agree with most of his analysis but sharply disagree with his statement Those plays, the failures and the interesting ones, should have been put on far more quietly. They should have been tried in workshops, without great publicity, and allowed to evolvein some cases, and to die in others.

title: PRICES FOR BONDS DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Boniil prices sank sharply and interest rates rose yesterday in the most pronounced drop of the credit market's current slaw, now in its sixth consecutive Week.

title: Steel Production Declined 3.3% During the Last Week of 1977
description: Steel production fell 3.3 percent during the last week of the year to 2.22 million tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. That brought total 1977 production to an estimated 124.43 million tons, a decline of 2.4 percent from 1976 production.

description: Sir Francis Bacon roundly laid it down that reading maketh a full man. The obverse' may be equally true: a fully considered diet is likely to make a man weW read. Only ruminate, if you will, upon the number of words and phrases. in; common.parlance that take their original sense from our baser appetites.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: Dial a number and the odds are not bad that you'll get a disembodied voice telling you to leave a message. One may not like the idea but that, like pollution, is progress. A good number of the disembodied voices these days are leaving cute or funny or impressive messages, and if such your desire, and your talent is nil, there's a service that will customwrite and record a message to your taste. RW Productions has two partners, Robert Warner, who produces television and radio commercials, and Peter Waldren, a wellknown announceractor who does many voiceovers for television commercials. The prices for the professional recording for your telephone answering machine are $75 and up, depending on how complicated it turns out to be. The address is RW Productions, P.O. Box 640, Grand Central Station, New York, N.Y. 10017. Or call (212) 6977754 for more information. You don't need two guesses to know that you'll be asked to leave a message.

title: Private Lives
description: IT WAS A traditional Christmas. That is, the Los Angeles Rams lost another playoff football game on television. On the other hand, it was a notsotraditional Christmas, at least for Dmitri, because it occurred for him on Thursday while the rest of the world waited until Sunday; and because for the entire week he was sunk a stupor so profound that his family and friends mistook it for a state of grace; and because, inexplicably, things seemed to go well. Nobody fell on a sword. The only argument after the opening of the presents had to do with whether the house would then listen to Handel's Messiah or to the Beach Boys. The Beach Boys? Hadn't they years ago stiffened and petrified? Hadn't they been recycled into surfboards and bowling alleys? Was it still necessary to take the Beach Boys seriously?

title: 911 Calls in New York City Become Too Popular
description: In the decade since the New York City Police Department became the first in the country to install the 911 emergency system, says Sgt. Louis Guletta of the department's communications section, service has almost become a victim of its own success.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: It is essential to diitinguish the goal of racial justice from specific methods that may serve it badly. I would therefore question the conclusion in a recerit editorial that a decision by the Supreme Court against the medical school at Davis would make all forms of affirmative action suspect. On the contrary, because the Bakke case involves the legitimacy of quotas in medical admissions, and because quotas have generated especially widespread public opposition, their elimination would surely strengthen, rather than weaken, public support for other, more acceptable forms of affirmative action: recruitment, remedial education, and admissions criteria adjUsted for past.educational and social disadvantages. Quqtas also have a deleterious effeCt on standards in medical education, and most medical schools have avoided or abandoned this ap p.roach. The problem of standardsi.e., the right of society to be assured of the quality of its. physicians=deserves attention: as a major element in the social background of the Bakke case, even,though that case may focus legally only on the rights of applicants for entry to a rewarding profession.

title: CARTER ACTS TO END CIVIL SERVICE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3  President Carter plans to send proposed legislation to Congress next month to abolish the 95yearold Civil Service Commission and replace it with two agencies, one of them independent of the White House.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: AFRICAN DAWN (Farrell). Dakar Jan. 14, Conakry 16, Monrovia 19, Abidjan 22, Tema 25 and Matadi Feb. 2; sails from Joralemon Si., Brooklyn. Letters, prints and parcel post for Mali, Senegal, Guinea, Liberia, Ivory Coast, Ghana and the Republic of Zaire.

title: Deaths
description: ACKERMANPaul. We mourn the Passing of a beloved friend, a dedicated journalist who as music editor of the Billboard for almost 40 years helped so many young performers, songwriters, record producers, and music publishers attain topmost recognition. His concepts of the everIncreasing potential of the musicrecord industry served to stimulate its growth as a malor influence around the world. With his sister, Evelyn and his brother, Martin, we share the memory of his inspiring accomplishments.

title: Arkansas Bowl Victory: Morality Play?
description: MIAMI, Jan. 3Never underestimate a hog, especially if he happens to be wearing an Arkansas football jersey. This was the jubilant message more than 15,000 Razotbac% lovers were exchanging here today as they continued celebrating their team's stunning 316 upset of secondranked Oklahoma in last night's 44th Orange Bowl Classic.

title: Teachers Walk Out in Canton, Ohio, After Talks on Salary Break Down
description: CANTON, Ohio, Jan. 3 (UPI)Children returning to school today after holiday vacations found that 85 percent of their teachers in the city school system had walked off the job after efforts to reach an agreement on salaries failed last week.

title: Texas Stars Pick Agent
description: Texas two star football players, Earl Campbell, the Trophywinning running back, and the Outland Trophywinning defensive tackle, Brad Shearer, have chosen Michael Trope of Los Angeles as their agent. Campbell and Shearer figure to be among the top National Football League draft picks. Trope, who has represented five of the last six Heisman Trophy winners, represented Tony Dorsett and Ricky Bell, last year's top two choices, among his clients.

title: The New York Times/William E. Sauro
description: A GOOD DAY ON THE SLOPES: The ski runs were busy at the Vernon Valley ski area yesterday as swirling snowmaking machines added to snow that fell over the weekend for an excellent surface in the brilliant sun.

title: 60mute Gourmet
description: ALTHOUGH I have spent the majority of my years in one kitchen or other, I find myself rarely bored by cooking. It was. an adventure for when I was an apprentice and it is an adventure now that all the young chefs start to look more and more like children. Creating dishes, combining unaccustomed ingredients, can be interesting pastime, and that's the way I feel about the dish here.

title: Crimeless Victims Often Have Cause for Complain rosecutors Find
description: It's criminal! they say, when their landlord declines to fix a leaky roof, when their welfare checks do not arrive on time, when a business deal does not work out, or when an item ordered from a catalogue turns out bearing scant resemblance to the enticing photograph.

title: NEWYORK TELEPHONE ASKS RATE REHEARING
description: In a strongly worded petition that appeared to be laying the groundwork for a court fight against the New York State Public Service Commission, the New York Telephone Company has asked for a rehearing to get a larger rate increase than the agency granted last month.

title: India, the Atom and a Candid Microphone
description: A few weeks ago we expressed the hope that India Mould, during President Carter's visit, back up its pledges of peaceful use of the atom by accepting international inspection of all its nuclear facilitiei and materials. We now know that Mr. Carter was unsuccessful in obtaining these fullscope safeguards, and that Prime Minister Desai was pretty adamant in refusing. But the open television microphone that picked up this discouraging Carter report to Secretary Vanceand created a minor diplomatic embarrassmenthas also given some reason for hope.

title: Notre Dame Officials Celebrate in Dallas
description: DALLAS, Jan. 3 (AP)Notre Dame officials and Cotton Bowl Athletic Committee officials celebrated the Fighting Irish's No. 1 ranking tonight with Cokes, beer and spareribs at a downtown Dallas hotel.

title: Amex Opens '78 With New Chief And Mayorbut Old Site Issue
description: It was a special day yesterday at the American Stock Exchangethe first trading day of the year, the first day in office of its new chairman and the first appearance of the new Mayor of New York City before a business audience.

title: Sadat Said to Ease His Palestine Stand Before Carter Talks
description: CAIRO, Jan. 3Informed Egyptian officials said today that President Anwar elSadat would take a moderate and flexible approach to the problem of a Palestinian state during his meeting tomorrow in Aswan with President Carter.

title: Deaths
description: BLUMENTHALMax 80, beloved husband of Berdie, father of Jere and Arnold. Grandfather of Vicki, Jeffrey, Marlene and Jill. Services at BoulevardPark West Chapel 115 W. 79 St, Thursday, Jan 5 at 10AM and will receive friends 7:30.9:30PM Wednesday.

title: Opera: Tlederniaus From the Royal
description: LONDON I T WAS THE. NEW YEAR, and, as so many: opera houses around theworld do, the Royal Opera at Covent Garden started thingsoff. Monday. night with. Johann Strauss's Die Fledermaus., Only this, was a brandnew production with a distinguished cast. For one reason or another, this greatest of all. operettas has been out of the Royal Opera repertory Tor about 40. years. So the company went all out to make amends. The production was handsome,. the singing was of top international standards and everybodyespecially the. casthad wonderful time.

title: U. of Washington Player Arrested in Burglary
description: IRVINE, Calif.. Jan. 3 (AP)Mike Ogilvie, a reserve strong safety on the University of Washington football team, was arrested early today in connection with a burglary at the hotel where part of the team was staying for the Rose Bowl game. the police said.

title: Comissiona New Adviser To American Symphony
description: Sergiu Comissiona, conductor of the Baltimore Symphony, has been named music adviser of the American Symphony Orchestra.

title: Bethlehem Steel. Closing Iron Mina In Ontario in March, Idling 275.
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Jan. 3 (AP)The Bethlehem Steel Corporation, citing busi! ness conditions and reduced ore requirements, said today it would shut down an iron ore mine in Ontario at the end of March, idling 275 workers.

title: Books of The Times
description: INTEREST in Virginia Woolf as novelist has always lagged behind interest in her as a personality. She has suffered the fate of all literary victims of suicide, attracting critics less for her literary worth than for the questions her enigmatic last act raises Now the wheel has turned, and in the biographies; in her own letters, in the gossiping memoirs. of her contemporaries and even in recent literary studies that have emphasized her feminism, the image of Mrs. Woolf as rarefied, alienated, suit generic writer philosophically tangential to 20thcentury literature is being challenged.

title: U.S. STEEL TO CLOSE YOUNGSTOWN MILLS; TIMING IS UNCERTAIN
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 3Edgar B. Speer Jr., chairman of the United States Steel Corporation, said today that the. company's steel facilities in the Youngstown, Ohio, area, which provided jobs for 5,000 workers, would eventually have to be closed because of very serious competitive disadvantages.

title: Los Angeles Judge Letting Schools Act On Integration Now
description: LOS ANGELtS, Jan. 3: (UPI)Judge Paul Egly of Superior Court decided today to allow immediate implementation of the Los Angeles School board's controversial integration plan and hold off for at least a year any determination Of the plan's azinstitutionalitY.

title: Pensions: A $100Billion Misunderstanding
description: The only line that concerns most of us about pensions from a private business is the bottom line. It takes whiff of scandalinsider shenanigans, or dealings with gangstersto transform the arcane world of other people's pensions into headline news. But the pension issue with the greatest potential impact on Americans has little to do with improper conduct by pension managers..

title: Despite Success in 2 Big Cities, 911 Phone System Lags
description: Ten years ago, when the President's Crime Commission recommended a universal telephone number for reporting police emergency situations, the experts of the Bell System agreed that 911 would be it. There were high hopes in Washington, and some officials even spoke of a nationwide 911 network.

title: Ousted Judge in Rape Case Says Feminists Will 'stoop to  Any Low
description: MADISON, Wis., Jan. 3 (AP) Former Judge Archie Simonson,. driven out of office by feminist groups as a result of his comments in a teenage rape case, says that he has less respect for women's erouos than he had before his ouster.

title: Christoph Meier, Biodynamic Cheese Whiz
description: WHILE farmers elsewhere in the nation talk of strikes and protest, Christoph Meier, a Swiss born farmer working 350acre farm in this tiny upstate commu ???ty, worries more about outgrowing his cheese aging room and marketing his stoneground wheat and rye flour.

title: Elizabeth Hite Wed To Dennis D. Miller
description: Elizabeth Mallory Hite and Dennis Drake Miller were married yesterday in the Episcopal Church of the Resurrection by the Rev. Michael G. Koonsman and the Rev. Jere T. Farrah.

title: TEAMSTER WELFARE AIDE AGREES TO RETURN $560,000
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3 (UPI)The Labor Department announced today that Robert C. Knee Jr., administrator of an Ohio teamsters welfare fund, had agreed to return $560,000 in assets he was accused of accepting illegally.

title: Bully Hill Wine: An Appeals Court Ruling
description: A Federal Appeals Court ruled yesterday that Walter S. Taylor may use his signature on the labels of wine bottles from his Bully Hill vineyards in Hammondsport, N.Y., but only with an appropriate disclaimer that he is not connected with the Taylor Wine Company.

title: 5 Union College ExPlayers Are Taken On by RedWings
description: SCHENECTADY, N.Y., Jan. 3 (UPI)Five former Union College hockey players who quit with the rest of the team last week have joined the Detroit Red Wings and were assigned today to their farm clubs. The school also announced an interim replacement for Coach Ned Harkness, whose resignation prompted the departure of the players.

title: 1775 Farm Still Hotheland for a 7th Generation
description: WESTTOWN, N.Y.At a time when obituaries. are frequently written about the family farm, The seventh generation of Lains is working on the dairy farm started by their greatgreatgreatgreaf grandfather in 1775 here in Orange County.

title: A Successful Writer On the Right Track
description: THE surface of James F. Fixx's suburban existence appears deceptively average and early American, with its black shutters, open. hearth and antiquey &con It is only behind closed doors in the house in Riverside, Conn., that his standard deviation shows  in the kitchen cabinets, where there is enougn pasta to supply, a small Italian bistro for a week:. in the basement, which sports a clothesline festooned with the kind of decrepit Tshirts and athletic gear traditionally found aging underneath the bureau of a 14yearold boy; and in the attic where, behind a book, case, there are three pairs of red running shoes in individual plastic bags, never worn, not to be confused with the three pairs of blue running shoes on the stairs, worn many times before.

title: HARVEY SEABURY FORD
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Jan. 3 (AP)Harvey Seabury Ford, an associate editor of The Toledo Blade, died Saturday night in Tciledor. hospital after a short illness. He was 62 years old.

title: Best Buys
description: FRIGID WEATHER in Florida and on the coffee plantations, higher processing costs, rising cocoa prices, government support paymerits and America's penchant for fast food all played a role in raising the cost of feeding a family of four in New York City during 1977.

title: Doctors Refuse Compensation Cases
description: About 120 doctors, mostly orthopedic specialists practicing on Long Island, have resigned their authorizations to treat Workmen's Compensation patients in a protest against fee schedules, according to the State Workmen's Compensation Board.

title: Personal Health For Skiers: Shapeup Exercises Page C10
description: MORE THAN five million Americans will take to the slopes this winter, and for more than a quartermillion their freespirited adventure in the snow will end with a painful injury. For those who must heal in a cast for months, the injury can mean a big medical bill and the end to skiing for the season. For all, the injury causes at least temporary inconvenience, not incapacitation.

title: News Summary
description: President Carter flew to Riyadh from New Delhi for talks with King Khalid of Saudi Arabia and Crown Prince Fand, the operating head of the government. A White House spokesman said the atmosphere was one of warm and mutual understanding as Mr. Carter outlined opportunities he saw for continued movement toward a comprehensive Middle East settlement. [Page A1, Column 6.]

title: Unemployment: Major Challenge Despite Record Number of Jobs
description: If there is one subject other than inflation that is bound to dominate the economic and political scene during 1978, it is unemployment. The level of joblessness has been stuck around 7Dercent of the national labor forceor approximately 7 million peoplefor the last nine months and is still only 2 percentage points below the highwater mark of the recent recession in May 1975.

title: The Business of America Is Still Business
description: NEW HAVENRecent defenses of corporate bribery of foreign governments, and now the current dispute over the expenseaccount martini, tell us that there are few indulgences of businessmen that cannot be defended as among the needs of business. The two controversies raise againthe latter in a nearfrivolous forman abiding issue: the powers and privileges to be granted to businessmen.

title: Specialist in Tough Assignments
description: They measured Stitch Sanders by the company he checked, because defense was his business. During his playing career he made a living sticking nearly as close to his opponents as the uniforms they wore: from a distance of six feet be could strip them of the ball as if he held it on a string. In college, he always guarded the best, regardless of size; in one season he checked Alan Seiden, at 5 feet 11 inches, then Jerry West, at 63, then Jerry Lucas, at 69. Through 13 pro seasons it was a steady diet of Elgin Baylors and Bob Pettits. Nothing but the best for Satch.

title: Democratic Chief Says First Goal Is Funds for Debts and Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3John C. White, the national chairman of tlie Democratic Party, said today that his first priority was to raise enough money to pay off 'the party's $2.3 million debt this year and to raise a $1 million fund for the fall Congressional and gubernatorial campaigns.

title: Sale at Commodore To Begin Tomorrow
description: Furnishings and fixtures of the Commodore Hotel, about a million items in all, will go on sale at the hotel tomorrow to clear the way for the reconstruction project to turn the 2,000room Commodore into a 1,400room Hyatt Regency convention hotel.

title: Greene, Winston Fined
description: Joe Greene and Dennis Winston of the Pittsburgh Steelers have been fined for committing flagrant fouls in an American Conference playoff game at Denver, Commissioner Pete Rozelle announced in New York yesterday. Greene, a defensive tackle, was fined $5,000 while Winston, a middle linebacker and member of the Pittsburgh special teams, was fined $2,000.

title: Nebraska Congressman Bars Race For Senate to Run for Governor
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Jan. 4Charles Thone, a fourterm Republican Congressman of Lincoln, marked his 54th birthday today by filing for the Nebraska gubernatorial nomination.

title: Backgammon:
description: Atlanta, one of the country's fastestgrowing urban areas, is also rapidly becoming a major United States backgammon center. The Atlanta bacicgai mon Society, under the direction of Bette Breima n, is actively developing local interest in the game. The diagrammed position is taken from the intermediate section of one of the society's recent weekly tournaments.

title: Life Styles and the Law
description: The power of the word homosexual to cloud minds and stir passions has again been demonstrated in New York City. Scarcely had Mayor Koch promised, on his first day in office, to ban discrimination against homosexuals in the municipal employ than Richard Vizzini, the president of the firemen's union; attacked the proposal, warning that separate bathrooms, showers, and living facilities might have to. be provided for homosexual firemen. This sort of response lends credence the recent charges by such European figures as. Jean Paul Sartre, Gunter Grass and Alberto Moravia that antihomosexual prejudice is rife in this country.

title: Won't Yield Returns $8 In Sprint at Aqueduct
description: MayDon Stable's Won't Yield closed with a rush to overtake pacesetting Loaded or Busted yesterday and won the feature race at Aqueduct. Ridden by Ron Turcotte, the 5yearold son of Distinctive was clocked in 1:10 1/5 for the six furlongs and scored by half a length. The winning payoff was $8, $3.60 and $3.20 for $2 across the board.

description: If you prefer to procrastinate, ignore what follows, but now is the time for those of us who live in the Northeast to overhaul our fishing gear.

title: Fear of Families
description: MY GRANDMOTHER who spent the last part of her life upstairs thinking.about everything she could no longer control downstairs, was my first teacher about life. Not life as I knew it. or life as it might be in the future, but life as it used to be, when men wore kid gloves and asphalt was just gleam in God's bad eye.

title: PAUL JACOBS, AT 59; AUTHOR AND ACTIVIST
description: Paul Jacobs, an investigative reporter, social critic and radical activist, died Tuesday of cancer. in Mount Zion Hospital in San Francisco. Ile was 59% years old and dived at 2500 Filbert Street, San Trancisco.

description: TRENTON, Jan. 4A serious rift between the New Jersey State Police and the State Commission of Invostigation, a split that, could affect state efforts to keep organized crime, out of gambling casinos in Atlantic City, broke into the nnen today durine a legislative hearing.

description: OvertheCounter Quotations WEDNESSDAY, JANUARY 4, 1978

title: Bases Officials Propose Relocation of 14,000 U.S. Troops From South Korea to Forts Drum, Dix and Devins
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4Officials of thy Carter Administration and the Defense Department are proposing the relocation of. 14,000 troops from South Korea to three bases in the Northeast. They are Fort Drum, N.Y.; Fort Dix, N.J., and Fort Devens. Mass.

title: Books: A History of Guitars From Renaissance to Rock
description: THE AMERICAN Music Conference, a research organization serving, the music industry, estimate that 10.6 million gditarists are presently playing in the United States in amateur or professional capacities. In 1976, tnese guitarists bought 157,475 acoustic guitars and 114,755 electric models, spending more than $100 million. Guitars, as its author's proudly note, is the most comprehensive attempt so far. to treat the guitar phenomenon as a totality.

title: jimmy the Boulevardier Charms Parisians
description: PARIS, Jan. 4 President Carter flew here today from the Middle East and de: lighted thousands of Parisians at the start of a threeday visit with a stroll down the ChampsElyses.

description: ASWAN, Egypt, Jan. 4 President Carter met with President Anwar elSadat here today and then read a prepared statement in which he said that the Palestinians should be enabled to participate in the determination of their own future.

title: Jobs and Inflation: The Link
description: BOSTON, Jan. 4How can a country have high unemployment and inflation at the same time? The twin phenomena confound the theory we grew up with, that slack an economy reduces inflationary pressure. And it is a central problem for the United States today, social and political as well as economic.

title: U.S. Steel Expects A Continued Decline In Youngstown Area
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 4 (UPI)Officials of the United States Steel Corporation said today they felt Youngstown, Ohio, would continue to decline as a major steelproducing region but that no decision had been made to close plants sin that area of eastern Ohio.

description: ALBANY, Jan. 4The first legislator to get any kind of lasting inkfrom Plutarchwas Solon of Athens 25 centunes ago, which brings us, in a highly irregular order of descent to Stanley Steingutsteppingout from behind the pointsettias today to get his plaque for 25 years of being a legislator.

title: U. S, to Monitor Hiring Practices Of Big Concerns

description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Jan. 4 (AP)Debbie Stewart broke an 8888 tie with 1:10 remaining and Tara Heiss added two free throws with seven seconds left to give 1Qthranked Maryland a 9288 victory tonight over the University of California,,Los Angeles, in basketball.

title: IVAN NETTER, 52, EXECUTIVE OF ADVERTISING MAGAZINE
description: Ivan J. Netter, general manager of Media Decisions magazine and a former assistant to the national advertising manager of The New York Times, died yesterday at New York Hospital after a heart attack. He was 52 years old and lived at 6 Hunter Drive in Eastchester, N. Y.

description: The Cosmos signed. Vladislav Bogicevic, a star midfielder of the Yugoslav national team, to a threeyear contract worth $500,000 yesterday in an effort to fill the gap left by the departure of Pel.

description: PARIS, Jan. 4 (Reuters)  While President Carter held talks with President Valdry Giscard d'Estaing today, his wife, Rosalynn, waded through throngs of reporters to see the Pompidou Cultural Center.

title: Markets Anxieties on a Fed Run by Miller
description: Anxieties have been sweeping through the stock market, the bond markt and the foreignexchange market over the course of Fedelral Reserve policy under G. William Miller, who has been chosen by President The Economic Scene Carter to be the new chairman of the Federal Reserve Board. One major worry seems to be that the Fed will be less monetaristthat is, less committed to Keeping, we money supply growing within preset target rangesunder Mr. Miller than it was under Arthur F. Burns and that, as a result, inflation will worsen.

title: Weehawken Split Over Proposed Housing for Aged
description: WEEHAWKEN, Jan. 4This small Hudson County community has been embroiled since late last summer over plans to build the largest housing project for the elderly in the state, and no early solution of the conflict seems likely.

description: Mauro Bolognini.,.the Italian film di. rectoOvill be honored by a retrospective of five of his films, to be shown at the Museum of. Modern Art from Jan. 19 through Jan. 23. The series will include La Notte Brava (1959); 11 Bell'Antonio (1960); La Viaccia (1961), and Metello (1969).

title: ALBANY REPUBLICANS SCOFF AT GOVERNOR
description: ALBANY, Jan. 4The Senate majority leader, Warren M. Andeison, Republican of Binghamton, said today that Governor Carey's proposals for $750 million in new tax cuts proved that Mr. Carey's threeyear caterwauling of fiscal crisis was an outright fraud on the people.

title: WY ATT E. COOPER, ACTOR AND AUTHOR, DIES AT 53
description: Wyatt E. Cooper, author and actor, died early today of a heart ailment in Now York Hosnital. He was 53.

title: LegislatureStarts Out By Ending Old Term
description: ALBANY, Jan, 4A freshfromrecess Legislature got down to the business of the state today by adjourning In a technical maneuver intended to insure the balance of power beti,veen the Governor and the legislature body, the Legislature recessed last year at the end of its regular session instead of adjourning, soit could call itself back into session !without having to get the approval of twothirds of its meipliers or the Governor to call special session.

title: Television
Books of The Timies
description: LITERATURE AS OPERA, by Gary Schmidgall. 431 pages. Illustrated. Oxford. $15.95.LITERATURE as opera? The title is meant to provoke a slight widening of the eyes, probably, if not an actual doubletake. For reasons not hard to discover, the literary aspect of operaand, yes, many librettos can be honored with sucn a lofty descriptionis rarely taken seriously in our day by educated people. As Gary Schmidgall puts it, The epithet operatic is not a complimentary.one to modern writers. One of the most operatic of modern playwrights, Tennessee Williams, was crushed when his literary agent rejected The Rose Tattoo because it was material for an opera, not a play.

title: Text of Statements by Sadat and Carter,Following Meeting at Aswan
description: ASWAN, Egypt, Jan. 4 (AP)  Following are 'transcripts of the statements made by President Anwar,elSadat of Egypt and President Carter after their talkS:here today.

title: The Zebras and That Nonfumble
description: It's the National Footage League now. Except for the final scores, nobody seems to know what has happened until after. they inspect the instantreplays or the game filmsforward. backward and in slowmotion, Once upon Sports of The Times a time only the coaches and players used to say, I've got to look at the films. But lately even the zebras, the six game officials in the black and white striped shirts, haven't always known what happened until their supervisor, Art McNally, looks at the films and videotapes, as he has in the case of Rob Lytle's nonfumble in the American Conference championship game. Over and over in the N.F.L. offices yesterday, Rob Lytle of the Denver Broncos kept fumbling the football and Mike McCoy of the Oakland Raiders kept recovering it. But the zebras kept ruling that they had not seen the fumble occur. Judging by the footage viewed yesterday, the pileup of players in the goalline stand shielded the fumble from the zebras view. Moments later the nation, thanks to a NBC cameraman behind the end zone at field ldvel, saw the fumble clearly. None of the zebras was positioned at the cameraman's angle. Blame the blinded zebras for not having seen it. But don't blame them for not having awarded the nonfumble to the Raiders.

title: Adolfo Springs His Latest Collection
description: ATURBANED Glady Solomon started the applause rolling for the draped tulip top over narrow. pints. What's a tulip top?. It's a tunic, curved at the bottom to resemble a petal, sort of, and it's usually executed in crepe, de chine. Green or pink or creamcolored top, with black nants.

title: Radio City Music Hall to Close After. Easter Show, Koch Is Told
description: Radio City Music Hall, one of New York City's major theatrical and tourist attractions for.45 years, will close at the end'of its Easter show, Mayor Koch was told last night.

description: LIFE INSURANCE companies, nudged by both the Federal Trade Commission and consumer groups, are trying to take some of the mystery out of what a highly complex product.

description: PARIS:Jan. 4European monetary officials welcomed today President Carter's decision., announced in Washington and later here, to defend the ailing dollar more actively on foreignexchange markets, but warned it might prove a risky strategy.

description: PARIS, Jan. 4 (AP)  Following are excerpts from the text of President Carter's speech to a group of FrenchAmerican organizations here tonight.

title: Jury in Boston Starts to Decide Tribal Status of Mashpee Indians
description: BOSTON, Jan. 4The first and most pivotal phase of an Indian lawsuit laying claim to 11,000 acres on Cape Cod went to the jury today. The case may affect the outcome of a halfdozen similar Indian suits throughout the Northeast.

title: Earth Tremor North of Belgrade
description: BELGRADE, Jan. 4 (Reuters)  A moderate tremor shook an area about 55 miles northeast of Belgrade today, close to the YugoslavRumanian border, the seismological institute here reported. There were no reports of casualties or damage.

description: 79:50 A.M., WKCR. Chandos Anthems, Handel.

description: YONKERS, Jan. 4.Executives of Saks Fifth Avenue linnounced today that they would locate their expanded national distributiorWeenter on a 22acre site in Yonkers, bringing 200 to 300 new jobs to the state's', fourthlargest city over the next New Years.

title: Woman Named Head of Miami State Attorney's Office
description: MIAMI, Jan. 4A woman was appointed today to head the Dade County State Attorney's office, encompassing Miami, one of the most powerful and demanding Drosecutorial fobs in the nation.

description: T.OR THOSE who think of P.I. Tchaikovsky as the cat's pajaMas, the New York City Ballet May well have.put its best foot forward Tuesday night with an allTchaikovskv program.

title: GonetoSeed Bodies Shape Up in Ballet Classes
description: AS Gelsey Kirkland, Patricia McBride and other stars were leaving David Howard's ballet studio one recent afternoon, the last class of the day was straggling in. Most, carrying briefcases packed, with leotards and tights, bore no resemblance to the skinandbones professionals who, a few minutes earlier, were spinning across the floor. Coining in was a group of 15 men and 40 women with what Mr. Howard calls gonetoseedbodieshis adult beginners.

title: DOLLAR PLAN ROCKS FUTURES IN METALS
description: News that the Treasury and the, Federal Reserve were moving to bolster the sagging dollar sent shock waves through the preciousmetals futures markets yesterday.

title: Coleus Care: Keep Pinching

title: Piano: Classical and Jazz

The husbandandwife team went to town on tunes written by Mrs. Yakouboff, notably White Blues, and amiliar ones such as Joplin's The Entertainer.

title: U. SWILL INTERVENE TO PROTECT DOLLAR; CURRENCY REBOUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4  The Treasury and the Federal Reserve Board announced today that they were moving to prop up the international value of the dollar following a yearlong decline that accelerated in the aftermath of last week's announcement of a pending change at the helm of the Reserve.

title: Sergeant in Marines Is Arrested For Killing 2, Injuring 4 at Base
description: CAMP PENDLETON, Calif., Jan. 4 (AP) A Marine sergeant, whom witnesses said,was unhappy because he did not get a promotion,.opened fire with a pistol in a Camp Pendleton office today, killing two Marines and wounding two others, a Marine spokesmen said. The witnesses also said that the sergeant had stabbed two soldiers.

title: Sound
description: SHORTLY. AFTER the Civil War, Congress briefly considered proposal to shut down the Patent Office because, according to the sponsors of the measure, everything that could possibly be invented already had been. This argument, now ever, could not be proved, and invention was officially allowed to continue. Which is just as well, for otherwise we might have had to make do without the telephone, electric lights, the radio, motion pictures, television, airplanes and the automobile.

title: Camera Dealer Is Accused of CreditCard Scheme for Defrauding Bank

Clarence Herlihy of Glens Falls, N.Y., has been reappointed for a twoyear term to the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court for the Third Department, a spokesman for the Office of Court Administration said yesterday. JUstice Herlihy, who is 72 years old, has been a presiding justice of the Appellate Division.

Her husband coached the Olympic track team in 1936 and coached the famed Jesse Owens, the Star of the Games.

title: NEW & USEITL
description: The Tin Lizzie is backnot. in the car buff's garage but, this time, in the kitchen. A doityourself copper retinning kit bearing that name can make life easier tor the cook with a collection of copper pots, and pans. The kit includes a pure tin disk, a bottle of plumber's acid flux and instructions on retinning. The procedure takes less than 20 minutes and does not require exceptional dexterity. Each kit will retin a nineinch pot; the tin is of foil thickness so it can be cut with ordinary scissirs to fit a smaller pot. The process involves scouring the utensils with steel wool, moistening the worn area with flux, covering it with a piece of tin and then melting the tin over high heat (450 degrees). Any scraps can be wiped away with paper towel and used to patch small areas on utensils. To order Tin Lizzie, send $10 to Susan Lyon, Au Cuisine Inc., 43 Saddle Ranch Lane, Hillsdale, N.J. 07642.

title: Notes on People
description: Frank Emmick, who returned to the United States this week after being held prisoner by the CubanGovernment for 14 years, remarried his former wife Tuesday. They were divorced in 1957 after he left her and their two. children. Mr. Emmick is 63 years old; his wife, Raphaela, is 59. Mr. Emmick went to Cuba in 1959 and started a seafood export business. He was arrested and accused of spying when he tried to leave in 1963. The Cubans charged that he was a station chief for the Central Intelligence Agency.
