description: FRIDAY, JANUARY 6, 1978

title: U. S. TO PRESS ISRAEL ON PEACE PHDCIPLES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5American officials said today that the next step in Middle East diplomacy would consist of seeking Israel's agreement to join with Egypt and the United States, at talks in Jerusalem later this month, on a set of broad principles to govern more detailed ArabIsraeli negotiations.

title: Concert: Kubelik
description: THE Symphony No. 6 by Vaughan Williams is not the scarcest of musical commodities. John Barbirolli and Leopold Stokowski used to feature it with fair regularity, and in more recent years, other Conductors have taken up its cause. But the New York. Philharmonic has not been lavish in its presentation of this fine work. Its conductors simply have not been interested.

title: Koch Lets a 2d Official Use a City Car
description: Traveling home late at night by subway is difficult, exhausting and wasteful, the city's Corporation Counsel complained to Mayor Koch yesterday.

title: Jazz: Pizzarelli at the Pierre
description: BUCKY PIZZARELLI, the guitarist, has been heard in an impressive variety of settings in recent yearsas part of a provocative guitar duo with George Barnes, in longrunning solo stints at Soerabaja and at the restaurant called PS 77. with Benny Goodman's combos, in concert at Town Hall and, last fall, in support of Slam Stewart, the humming bassist at Hopper's.

title: Issue and Debate
description: When the spring semester begins next month in the New York City school system, newly hired teachers will once again be placed in schools as part of the continuing effort to achieve a racial balance among faculty members.

title: ExAtlantic City Postmaster Gets 25 Years in Theft
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Jan. 5Gordon F. Lawson, who helped mastermind a $1 million robbery of the Atlantic City Post Office, of which he was postmaster, was sentenced to 25 years in Federal orison.

title: State Department Is Critical
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The State Department sharply criticized today the plebiscite in Chile.

title: Screvane Resigns as Head of OTB
description: Paul R. Screvane resigned yesterday as president and chairman of New York City's Offtrack Betting Corporation.

title: 3 Editors Ask C.I.A. To Ban Use of Press Anywhere in World
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP)Three American newspaper editors told Congressmen today that the policy of the Central Intelligence Agency against using the American press should be extended to ban intelligence agency use of any reporters around the world.

title: Son Seals Brightens the Blues
description: Son Seals, who will be at the Bottom Line from Sunday through Tuesday, was born with the blues, and not just in the conventional sense. As the 13th child born into a black family in Osceola, Ark., he must have known some blue feelings. But the blues were all around him because his father, Jim Seals, operated a juke joint called the Dipsy Doodle Club in a big room built onto his family's house. Sonny Boy Williamson, Robert Nighthawk, Albert King and other wellknown bluesmen performed there from the time Son Seals was in the cradle, and his father, who had played piano, guitar, trombone and drums with the Rabbit Foot Minstrels, began giving him guitar lessons as soon as he showed some interest.

title: Broadway
description: SHELLEY WINTERS is returning to Broadway in Paul Zindet's celebrated The Effect of Gamma Rays on ManintheMoonMarigolds, which has never been on Broadway before, even though it won the Pulitzer Prize and virtually everything else as the best play for 1970. This is interesting not only because of Miss Winters, but also because ManintheMoonMarigolds will open at the Henry Miller Theater; it will be directed by A. J. Antoon, and it will be produced by Courtney Burr and Nancy Rosenthal. Peter Harvey will do the sets and costumes.

title: Cavaliers Top Nets, End Losing Streak at 5 Games
description: RICHFIELD, Ohio, Jan. 5 (AP)Walt Frazier led eight: Cavalers in double figures with 15 points as Cleveland snapped a fivegame National Basketball Association losing streak with, a 11094 victory over the New Jersey Nets tonight.

title: Goldin Won't Process Termination Pay For Another Beame Administration Aide
description: New York City's Comptroller, Harrison J. Goldin, refused yesterday to process another terminationpay application by a former Beame administration officialli because it exceeded the 54day limit Mr. Goldin had established.

title: Sports Today
description: Nets vs. San Antonio Spurs, at Rutg?? gymnasium, Piscataway. N.J., 8,P.M.

title: Carter Trip Adds Spice to FrenchPolitical Sauce
description: PARIS, Jan. 5When President Carter laid a wreath at the Arc de Triomphe and strolled down the ChampsElyses yesterday, there was one notable absentee among the hundreds of French political dignitaries  Jacques Chirac, the Mayor of Paris.

title: Abortion Standoff Prompts House To Weigh Limit on Riders to Bills
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5  Speaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr. has asked the House parliamentarians to study the feasibility of a rule change to keep appropriations bills free of policymaking riders, such as the ban on Medicaid abortions that tied up $61 billion for the Departments of Labor and Health, Education and Welfare.

title: Burke Gains in Court Tennis
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 5  Jimmy Burke of Philadelphia advanced to the semifinals of the. United States professional court tennis championship by defeating Joe Crane of the New York Racquet and Tennis Club, 64, 61, 61, today at, the Philadelphia Racquet Club.

title: METALS FUTURES RISE IN BARGAIN HUNTING
description: Prices of precious metals futures bounced back late yesterday as professional traders entered the market to pick up what they considered bargains.

title: People and Business
description: Nathan Most, a vice president of the American Stock Exchange, yesterday was elected president of the new American Commodity Exchange that has been established by the Amex to conduct trading in futures contracts for gold, silver, diamonds and other commodities.

title: Management
description: With the prospect of bigger higher Social Security payments ahead along with other inflationary cost rises, many businessmen are focusing on costcutting nossibilites this year.

title: Gypsies May Stag After All
description: The producer and director of a $6 million film version of King of the Gypsies reported progress in talks with union leaders yesterday and expressed hope that the production would not have to be moved from New York City to Chicago after all, as threatened on Wednesday.

title: DAYTON PUPILS TO ATTEND SCHOOLS OF THEIR CHOICE
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Jan. 5Members of the Dayton School Board voted today to allow parents the freedom of choice in decidingwhat public school they will send their children to starting next month.

title: Promising Appointments by Mayor Koch
description: As the National Crime Commission taught us a decade ago, criminal justice is a system, its parts as balanced as a mobile. Unless there are more prosecutors and judges, more arrests may not mean less crime, only longer delays before trial. Unless there are new prison cells, more trials may mean only more crowding. Still, given New York City's political pressures and temptations, mayors forget. Mayor Lindsay declares war on drug traffickersand almost overwhelms prosecution staffs. Mayor Beame cracks down on prostitution and smutand floods the courts. Now, in two appointments to the system, Mayor Koch has demonstrated his concern for its quality and his understanding of its coherence.

title: Companies Issue Earnings Figures
description: For period ended Nov. 30 unless otherwise Indicated. (N) indicates stock traded on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) American Stock Exchange, and (0) overMscounter.

title: ComicBook Marketplace Opens Sunday
description: Comicbook enthusiasts and collectors of other memorabilia will have the chance to meet, buy or trade the objects of their passion or just browse through the books, posters, magazines and other items on sale Sunday at the first Comic Book Marketplace. This event will be held one Sunday each month in the Midtown Room of the Taft Hotel, Seventh Avenues and 50th Street.

title: CAREY PLANS TO PUT INCOMETAX CUTS IN EFFECT ON JULY 1
description: ALBANY, Jan. 5The $500 million cut in personal income taxes proposed by Governor Carey, if enacted by the Legislature, would be reflected in taxpayers paychecks through lower withholding taxes beginning July 1, aides to the Governor said today.

title: Deaths
description: LEFKOWITZMortimer, M.D. The Medical Society of the County of Kings and The Academy of Medicine of Brooklyn record with deepest death regret the death of a Trustee and Officer the on Jan 4. Thepast membersee and Officers extend heartfelt condolences to his bereaved family. Bernard S. Post, MD, Pres. Bentley D. Merrim, MD, Sect

title: Flynt Buys Paper in Plains
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 5 (AP)Larry Flynt, the owner of sexoriented Hustler magazine who says that he has experienced a religious conversion with the aid of President Carter's sister, purchased a small weekly newspaper in the President's hometown of Plains today.

title: The Curfew:
description: It is 10 P.M.*Parerits, do you know where your children. are?

title: Bridge:
description: A unique charity bridge event will be played later this month in Nassau County. Instead of aiding an impersonal organization concerned with medical research or some other desirable cause, it will benefit one man who seems well qualified to be the neediest case in the world of bridge.

title: Deaths
description: ALCORNMatilda C. of Leonia, NJ on January 5, 1978. Beloved sister of Sarah Mills, Robert and Samuel Alcorn. Dear sisterinlaw of Helen Alcorn. Loving Aunt of John Taylor. Visiting hours at Blackley Funeral Home, corner of Broad and Elm Aves. Ridgefield, NJ, 48pm on Saturday. Religious service Saturday at 8pm. Interment George Washington Memorial Park, Paramus NJ. Monday January 9, 10am.

title: An 800YearOld Hit That's Still Going Strong
description: It Is not quite true that The Play of Daniel has been a smash hit for 800 years. What is true is its popularity from the year 1150, when it was presumably written, until 1250. For a century its performance was a New Year's tradition in the French city of Beauvais. Then, like many other cultural treasures of the Middle Ages, it disappeared under the tidal wave of the Renaissance.

title: Indiana, 91, Routs Iowa In BigTen Opener, 6951
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Jan. 5(AP)Mike Woodson, a sophomore, and Wayne Radford, a senior, combined to score 31 points tonight and helped Indiana defeat Iowa, 6951, in the Big Ten Conference basketball opener for both teams.

title: Desai Predicts India Will Suffer If U.S. Refuses to Provide Uranium
description: NEW DELHI, lan. 5 (UPI)Prime Minister Morarji R. Desai told a group of United States senators today that India would suffer if America refused to supply it with enriched uranium.

title: Sales of '78 Cars Lagging After 6.1% Gain Last Year
description: DETROIT, Jan. 5The sale of new domestically produced tars in the United States last year rose 6.1 percent above the impressive 1976 level, but a continuing decline in the purchase of 1978 Model cars has cast a shadow onthe prospects for. another good year for the nation's automobile industry.

title: All of the Commodore They Could Carry
description: There were those at the CommodoreHotel yesterday, like Louise Vinciguerra of Brooklyn, who had come to find memorabilia. Others, like Molly Moons, also of Brooklyn, came to buy beds. Ann and Bruce MacCutchen of Matawan, N.J., found lamps and silverware. But Lorna Brown of Queens wanted neither memorabilia, nor beds, nor lamps nor silverware.

title: DOLLAR CATCHES UP IN EUROPEAN TRADING
description: PARIS, Jan. 5The battered dollar staged a, strong catchup rally in Europe today following promises by the United States of active market support for its currency, but there was widespread agreement here that the dollar's strength may prove only temporary.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE honeymoon between physicists and the American public does indeed seem to be over. It lasted longer, from World War II until the mid1960's, than most honeymoons; and it cost us billions of dollars; and we got to know some of the most interesting minds and personalities of the age; and they were ?? worse morally than any other group no citizensalthough, as Daniel J. Kevles makes clear in this uncommonly good book, they thought of themselves as quite a bit better, which is undemocratic.

title: News Summary
description: FRIDAY, JANUARY 6, 1978

title: Southern Justice and the Case of Joan Little
description: Joan Little gained national attention in 1975 when she was acquitted of murder in the death of a prison guard she claimed had tried to rape her. After the trial in Raleigh, N. C., she was returned to jail to serve out a 7to10year term for breaking and entering. Miss Little escaped last October and was captured two months later in Brooklyn. The State of North Carolina is seeking her extradition.

title: Lance Completes Sale of Stock In Georgia National Bank to Arab
description: WASHINGTON. Jan 5 (AP)  Bert Lance, who resigned as Federal Budget Director after a controversy over his banking practices, completed the sale of 121,906 share of hank stock today for more than $2.4 million, his attorney said.

title: WEEKEND MOVIE CLOCK
Pan Am Seeks to Cut Flights
description: MIAMI, Jan. 5Pan American World Airways announced today that it had filed a petition with the Civil Aeronautics Board to suspend service between Miami and Mexico City because of annual losses of about ,$4.5 million. Pan Am has been operating the flights since 1931.

title: At the Movies
description: ON MGM's fabled Sound Stage 30, where Esther Williams, wearing a fishscale bathing suit and an unshrinkable smile, once disported herself in a vast swimming pool among a shoal of beautiful marine creatures, there now is stored a million pounds of mud.

title: YETTA RUBIN SLUTSKY, 87; COFOUNDER OF NEVELE
description: Yetta Rubin Slutsky, who, with her husband, Joseph, founded the Nevele Hotel and Country Club and built it into a leading resort in the Catskill Mountains, died Wednesday at her home in Ellenville. N.Y. She was 87 years old.

title: Market Place
description: Efforts by the Municipal Assistance Corporation to save interest and to restructure its repayment schedule on $213 million of its highcost debt have been completed.

title: Kings Tie Flyers on Goal By Rookie in Final Period
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 5 (AP)Dave Taylor, a rookie, scored at 12:55 of the final period to boost the Los Angeles Kings to a 44 tie with the Philadelphia Flyers in the National Hockey League tonight. Taylor, the 197677 National Collegiate Athletic Association scoring champion from Clarkson College, circled the net and stuffed the puck past the Philadelphia goalie, Bernie Parent.

title: Donations From Jerseyans Help Fund for Neediest Top $800,000
description: Gifts from 500 donors, including many from New Jersey, have been received by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, totaling $27,849.15. As a result of yesterday's contributions the fund has now gone over the $800,000 mark. Since the campaign began Dec. 5, the Neediest Cases Fund has received $811,202.97 from 6.429 donors.

title: St. Stephen's Crown Is Back in Budapest Alter 32Year Exile
description: BUDAPEST, Jan. 5The Crown of St. Stephen, the historic symbol of Hungarian nationhood, returned home tonight after more than 32 years in exile, mostly in the United States.

title: Vilas, Borg, Gottfried, Orantes Win at Garden
description: Guillermo Vilas outlasted Jimmy Connors, 64, 36, 75, last night in a threehour tennis classic that will rank among the sport's more inspiring moments.

title: The Delay in Meeting U.S. CleanAir Goals
description: It is becoming evident that highquality breatheable air, which Congress in 1970 envisioned as obtainable in five years, will not be available for many years.

title: Vietnam vs. Cambodia
description: Only a decade ago, American leaders were still arguing that without a gigantic United States military presence, all Southeast Asia would succumb to monolithic Communism. Today, the American piesence is absent, and two Communist states in that regionVietnam and Cambodiaare deeply enmeshed in a bloody war. Yet their neighbors, Communist Laos and the nonCommunist states of Southeast Asia, are largely unaffected.

title: Dividends
description: THURSDAY, JANUARY 5, 1978

title: Jersey Teachers Strike Ends
description: HOLMDEL, N.J., Jan.6 (UPI)Teachers at St.John Vianny High School here reached an agreement on their first contract and returned to classes yesterday after a oneday strike.The twoyear pact provides an average salary increase of 9.2 percent in the first year, retroactive to Sept.1, 1977, and 12 percent in the second year.A dental plan is also included in the new contract.

title: Skepticism of Spectators Is Aroused at the Garden
description: Two months ago, Refaat Ansary phoned his brother from London and told him to buy two tickets for the Grand Prix Masters tennis competition. He wanted to see his favorite player, Bjorn Borg.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:eliminated or drastically reduced.Not until this takes place will our hugo traffic mess start to be cleared up.

title: Reserve Lifts Its Bank Loan Rate; Stocks Off, Citibank Raises.Prime
description: The Federal Reserve Board announced yesterday in Washington that it had approved an increase in the discount ratethe rate that it charges on loans to member commercial banksto 6 percent from 6 percent.

title: Pallottine Order's ExFund Raiser IndictedinFund Pvlisappropriations
description: BALTIMORE, Jan 6The former fundraising director of the Pallottine Fathers Missionary Society, the Very Rev.Guido John Carcich, was indicted today by a Baltimore grand jury on 60 counts of misappropriating the order's funds and one of obstruction of justice.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Tadzhiks and Uzbeks Try to Live the Way Russians Do
description: DUSHANBE, U.S.S.R.The main street in Dushanbe, the capital of the Soviet Central Asian republic of Tadzhikistan, is not named after a local hero but after Lenin.Most of the faces on Lenin Street are not ethnic Russian but Middle Eastern and Asian, though the low buildings have a distinctly Russian atmosphere.And the Russian families who live here.if a professor and his wife are at all typical, preserve their Russianness as well.

title: Finley Gets Peace.Bid, Lawyer Says
description: An attorney for Charles O.Finley disclosed yesterday that he had received a suggestion of a solution to the seemingly endless saga of Vida Blue: If Finley would drop the appeal of his case against Bowie Kuhn, the baseball commissioner in return would approve the $1.75 million sale of Blue to the Cincinnati Reds.

title: Farm Strikers Give Bergland a FivePoint Plan
description: OMAHA, Jan.6 (UPI)Leaders of the national farm strike, Contending that they were going broke because of the Carter Administration's farm policies, presented a fivepoint remedial plan today to Agriculture Secretary Bob Bergland.

title: Dollar's Decline Continues to Push Commodities Up
description: The weakness of the United States dollar in world markets continued to have a positive impact on commodity future prices yesterday.In times of inflation here, as evidenced by the weak dollar, commodities tend to be strong.

title: Energetic Lobbying
description: PITTSBURGHThe kids need new clothes for school; the car needs repair; the house needs more insulation.As these worries weren't enough, the other day a letter arrived from the Union of Concerned Scientists advising me of the serious risks I face from nuclearradiation accidents.

title: Bail for Joan Little Is Denied by Justice in Brooklyn
description: A State Supreme Court justice in Brooklyn refused yesterday to set any bail for Joan Little, the 23yearold black woman who escaped from a North Carolina jail last October and was captured in Brooklyn last month.

title: One Killed, One Missing, Six Hurt In Army Ammunition Plant Blast
description: RADFORD, Va., Jan.6 (AP)Five thousand pounds of nitrogylcerine blew up at the Radford Army Ammunition Plant early today, leaving one worker dead, another missing and six injured.

title: Nerve Gases Will Go To Arsenal at Denver
description: WASHINGTON, Jan.6 (UPI)  The Army announced today that it planned to move more than 650 gallons of chemical warfare agents, including lethal nerve gases, from 14 military posts to the Rocky Mountain Arsenal at Denver for disposal.The move is to take place within the next 10 days.

title: U.S.Alarm Grows Over Italian Red Push for Power
description: WASHINGTON, Jan.6Officiala in the Carter Administration are expressing growing concern over what they believe is the likelihood that Italy's ruling Christian Democratic Party may soon bow to Communist pressure for a larger voice in government.

title: Deaths
description: ANDOLSEKPenny (Ruopp) age 28 Of 1045 East Saddle River Road, Hohokus, N.J.Died January 5, 1978 at Woodcliff, N.J.Wife of Charles M. Andolsek.Daughter of Robert W. Ruopp of Putnam Valley, N.Y.Sister of Robert W.Ruopp, Jr., Pleasant Valley, N.Y.Paternal granddaugh, ter of Martin W..and Emily K. Ruopp of Niagara Falls, N.Y.Funeral service in the Otto Redanz Funeral Home, Inc., Michigan Avenue at 10th St, Niagara Falls, N.Y.Monday, January 9.at 10 A.M.Burial Riverdale Cemetery, Lewiston, N.Y.It is the family's wish that tributes be made to Multiple Sclerosis Society of Lehigh County, Valley.Unit, Allentown, Pa.

title: Cowles Will Distribute Its Assets and Dissolve
description: In a major redirection of its corOrate operations into television, Cowles Communications Inc.announced yesterday that it would distribute its assets to stockholders and then dissolve the company.

title: Beame Alleges a Double Standard By Goldin on Severance Payments
description: Former.Mayor Abraham D.Beame yesterday accused City Comptroller Harrison J.Goldin of applying a double standard in a growing controversy over, large cash severance payments to officials of the Beame administration.

title: Weekly News Quiz
description: Questions are based on news reports in The Times in the last week.

title: Congressmen Meet Peking Aide
description: PEKING, Jan.6 (Reuters)Ten members of the United States Congress, led by Senator Alan Cranston, Democrat of California, met for almost three hours today with the Chinese Foreign Minister, Huang Hua.Informed sources said there had been a wide exchange of views on ChineseAmerican relations and the main international issues.

title: Miami Lawyer Gets Indeterminate Term For Bribing a Judge
description: Shaya Estrumsa, a Miami lawyer convicted in September of bribing a judge to lower the bail in a narcotics case, was sentenced yesterday to an indeterminate sentence of up to three years in nrison.

title: Ali: I'll Fight for $12 Million
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Jan.6 (AP)Muhammad Ali, the heavyweight champion, today said he would defend his title against Ken Norton just as soon as someone gets $16 million in the bank.I'm going to fight for $12 million end Norton will get $4 million.

title: Sally Eilers, Actress, Is Dead; Appeared in More Than 40 Films
description: Sally Eilers, the actress who started her career in a Mack Sennett film called The Goodbye Kiss in the 1920's and appeared in more than 40 films with Will Rogers, Spencer Tracy and Buster Keaton, died at her home in Beverly Hills Thursday night.

title: Jordan to Manchester United
description: LEEDS, England, Jan.5 (AP)Joe Jordan, Leeds 26yearold Scottish international soccer player, was acquired today by Manchester United for $746,000.Jordan will not be able to play for his new club for two weeks.He starts a.threematch suspension Monday.During his seven years with Leeds, Jordan scored 47 goals.

title: The American Connection
description: The success of President Carter's visit to France, which he undertook at the urging of President Giscard d'Estaing, will be judged ultimately by its impact on the country's crucial parliamentary election in March. The CommunistSocialist electoral alliance.desnite hickering, retains its lead in the opinion polls.But the recent Communist conversion from Stalinism remains suspect for most Frenchmen while the American connection, despite decades of Communist and Gaullist attack, remains popular, even for most Socialists.

title: Renaissance Sounds Become Music to Their Ears
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 6One girl took the last dainty nibbles from the core of an apple, another had already settled down to her homework, but most of the 100 or so students managed at least to look interested as Mrs.Ramona Matthews talked.

title: Answers to Weekly Quiz
description: 1.The countries President Carter visited are Poland, Iran, India, Saudi Arabia, Egypt, France and Belgium.

title: Shah to Visit Sadat at Aswan
description: ASWAN, Egypt, Jan.6 (Reuters)The Shah of Iran will make a oneday visit here on Monday for talks with President Anwar elSadat on the Middle East situation, the Egyptian Middle East News Agency said today.Well informed sources in Aswan had said earlier that the Shah was due on Jan.15.

title: One of Its Officials Calls the Public Broadcasting ColLporation Wasteful
description: Stiriging criticism of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting for Wastefulness, lack of leadership and general failure to serve as a heat shield against Government interference in national programming has been voiced by a prominent director of the corporation whose term is about to expire.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ATLANTIC CONVEYOR (ACL).Goteborg Jan.IN, Oslo 70, Helsinki 22 and Leningrad 24; sails from Pt. Elizabeth, N.J.

title: Area Gasoline Prices Down 0.7% in October
description: Average reail gasoline prices in New York and northeastern New Jersey declined seventenths of 1 percent in October, according to figures released yesterday by the regional commissioner of the Department of Labor's Bureau of Labor Statistics.For the 10 months ended Oct.31, the office added, average gasoline prices in the area rose only 2.5 percent, considerably below the nationwide average increase of 4.4 percent.

title: Islanders Farm Bergeron
description: UNIONDALE, L.1., Jan.6 (AP)The New York Islanders today assigned Michel Bergeron, a right wing, to their Fort Worth farm.Bergeron will remain with Fort Worth for 14 days to work himself back into shape.He had been sidelined with a back sprain.In 18 games with the Islanders, Bergeron had eight goals and five assists.

title: McGuire Names a New Chief of Police Operations
description: Police Commissioner Robert J.McGuire has selected William J.Devine, now one of 12 assistant chiefs in the Police Department to be the new chief of operations.

title: Walter S.Atkinson, Eye Doctor, Cited Often for His Work
description: DT: Waiter Sydney Atkinson, a prominerkeye doctor and surgeon with more than 50 years of medical service, died yesterday in the House of the Good Samaritan in Watertown, N.Y., where he formerly was chief of the eye department.He was 86 years old and lived in Watertown.

title: John D.MacArthur, Billionaire, Dies
description: John D.MacArthur, the Florida insurance magnate and real estate billionare who was said to be one of the nation's wealthiest men, died of cancer early yesterday at Good Samaritan Hospital in West Palm Beach, Fla.He was 80 years old.

title: Citibank Incredses Prime Rate to 8% 3 Major Lenders Follow Suit
description: Responding to higher shortterm rates in the money market, Citibank, the nation's second largest bank, yesterday raised its prime rate to 8 percent from 7 percent.The move brought the key corporate loan rate to its highest level since October 1975.

title: Indochina Shootin Pauses as Verbal War Goes On
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Jan.6The armed conflict between the Communist nations of Vietnam and Cambodia appears to have come to a pause while their verbal war continues unabated.

title: Crown of St.Stephen Formally Returned to Hungary
description: BUDAPEST, Jan.6Secretary of State Cyrus R.Vance solemnly returned the Crown of St.Stephen to Hungairy today, and said the act reflected improved relations between our peoples and Governments,

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: New York employees were ordered by Mayor Koch yesterday to limit their telephone calls to five minutes whenever possible.Mr.Koch estimate that a saving of $650,000 a year jn telephone charges could result.

title: Watson Goes 4 Up on 131 in Tucson
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Jan.6 (AP)Tom Watson took a fourstroke lead in to second round and said he was in shape to win the first pro golf tournament of the season, the Tucson Open.

title: MARK F.WELCH, EXAIDE TO ALBANY LEADERS, 70
description: Mark F.Welch, who was counsel to five successive majority leaders of the New York State Senate until he retired six years ago, died Thursday in the Livingston Infirmary in Geneseo.He was 70 years old and lived on Avon Road in Genesco.

title: Schmidt Ends Visit to Egypt
description: ASWAN, Egypt, Jan.6 (Reuters)Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany left here today for Rumania after a 10day visit during whihc he had talks with President Anwar elSadat, the official Middle East News Agency said.The Chancellor alio had a brief meeting here with President Carter on.Wednesday.

title: Raise the Ceilings
description: The United States housing industry has been through seven boomandbust cycles of increasing severity since World War II.In most cases, these cycles were preceded by periods of disintermediationwhich means that money flowed out of savings accounts in banks and thrift institutions as returns on Ether investments soared above these institutions legally enforced savings interest rates.Since savings accounts are the primary source of mortgage money, this outflow reduced the amount of funds available for financing homes.

title: Maxene Michal Fabe Wed to Guy Mulford 3d
description: In the Church Center for the United Nations yesterday afternoon, Maxene Michal Fabe, a writer and author, became the bride of Guy Davis Mulford 3d, head trader in New York of the corporatebond department of Alex. Brown & Sons, a securities concern based in Baltimore.

title: 2 Sisters Asphyxiated in Yonkers
description: YONKERS, N.Y., Jan.5 (UPI)Two elderly sisters were asphyxiated here early today by propane gas that seeped from a stov through their house, the police reported.The husband of the younger sister was hospitalized, also sutfering from gas inhalation, the police said.Officials said that they found the body of Leona Herman, 88 years old, in her bedroom and her 76yearold sister, Frieda Neumeyer, in the bedroom she shared with her husband, Anton, at 3 Allen Avenue South.

title: Michael Carney, Singer and Pianist, WithTrio at Carlyle
description: While Bobby Short is taking his annual winter leave from the Cafe Carlyle, Madison Avenue at 76th Street, his place is being taken by Michael Carney, a singer and pianist who is alsn the leader of a society band.

title: VERA CRAIG McCAW
description: Vera Craig McCaw, widow of Raymond Henry McCaw, a night managing editor of The New York Times who died in 1953, died Thursday in Montefiore Hospital, the Bronx, following surgery.She was 90 years old and had been living in the Fairfield Nursing Home, Riverdale, the Bronx, for several years after moving from Hudson View Gardens, Manhattan.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Two sophomore members of the Manhattan College basketball team have been dismissed from the college for academic reasons.Dino Larry, a starting forward from Poughkeepsie, N.Y., and Darryl Eady, a reserve from Jersey City, dropped below the minimum 1.8 gradepoint average during the fall semester.

title: Fund Diversion Laid To ExChief of I.D.C.
description: The complaint, tiled in united states District Court here, accused Mr.Goldsmith and the company, which operates the Port Authority, airport, utilities, and a gambling casino in Freeport, the Bahamas, with violating the antifraud, reporting and proxy provisions of the securities laws.

title: Dividends
description: LIQUIDATING

title: Justice Dept.Team Is Off for Seoul To: Begin Questioning Tongsun Park
description: WASHINGTON, Jan.6 (UPI)Accompanied by a liedetector expert from the. Federal Bureau of Investigation, a team of Justice Department officials left for Seoul today to begin a longawaited questioning of Tongsun Park about alleged South Korean influencebuying in Congress.

title: Administration.Cancels Program For Air Force Transport Plane
description: WASHINGTON, Jan.6 (Reuters)Tho Carter Administration has canceled a proposed $7 billion program to build Air Force transport aircraft for carrying troops and equipment to the battlefield. Government sources said today.

title: JOHN F.GORDON, 77; EXPRESIDENT OF G.M.
description: John F.Gordon, who retired in 1965 as president of the General Motors Corporation, died yesterday at the William Beaumont Hospital at Royol Oak, Mich.after a brief illness.Mr.Gordon was 77 years old and lived in Bloomfield Hills, a Detroit suburb.

title: Carver to Be Honored Tomorrow in Harlem
description: The Centennial Historical Society's observance of George Washington Carver Day will be held tomorrow at the State Office Building, 163 West 125th Street, in Harlem, to pay tribute to the agricultural scientist.

title: Study Finds One in Nine Students Each Month Is the Victim of a Theft
description: WASHINGTON, Jan.6 (AP)The typical student in junior or senior high school has about one chance in nine of having something stolen in a month, the Government says.

title: Twins Give Carew Bonus of $100,000
description: Rod Carew of the Minnesota Twins, who was named the American League's most valuable player for 1977 after leading the league with 388 batting average, has been awarded a $100,000 bonus by the Twins for his outstanding performance.

title: World News Briefs
description: LONDON, Jan.6 (AP)Donald J. Woods, the white South African newspaper editor who fled his homeland after the Government put him under restrictive banning orders, arrived here today and said he would try to have South African Government ministers declared international criminals.

title: INDIANS LOSE IN COURT IN FIGHT TO GAIN LAND
description: BOSTON, Jan.6A Federal jury decided today that the Wampanoag Indians of the Cape Cod town of Mashpee were not a tribe on key, Jegal dates of their history, thus balking the Indians' claim to a vast tract of land in the town.

title: Around the Nation
description: A retired coal miner was.killed in a volley of pistol fire on a picket line in eastern Kentucky yesterday and two companies in other states were besiege by striking coal miners, the Associated Press reported.

title: I apanese Data Show Tokyo Tried To Make World War II ABomb
description: Documents have come to light indicating for the first time that Japanese scienists were at work in World War II on an atomic bomb for use against this country but were thwarted by air raids, lack of official coordination and funds, and the backwardness of atomic physics in Japan.

title: Democrats Aiming at Senate Seat Are Wooing Jersey City's Mayor
description: JERSEY CITY, Jan.6Potential Demo cratic candidates for the United States Senate nomination are wooing Mayor Thomas F.X.Smith, who has become the most soughtafter political leader in New Jersey since he won the city election last May and took control of the Hudson County Democratic organization.

title: POPSIE RANDOLPH, AT 57; PHOTOGRAPHED JAZZMEN
description: Popsie Randolph, a road manager for Benny Goodman and Woody Herman who became a very successful photographer of jazz musicians and showbusiness personalities; died of cancer yesterday in Phoenix, where he had lived for the last two years.He was 57 years old.

title: Angola: Quagmire for Cuba?
description: WASHINGTQN.Jan.6  Government specialists on Africa have concluded that the growing Cuban presence in Angola is probably caused in large part by Cuba's inability to extricate itself from a vicious euerrilla war that may be unwinnable.

title: Agreement Is Reached in Rockland Strike
description: NEW CITY, N.Y., Jan.6A tentative agreement that could end the 10day strike by Rockland County employees was announced today by both sides.

title: Nerve Gas Will Go To Arsenal at Denver
description: WASHINGTON, Jan.6 (UPI)  The Army announced today that it planned to move more than 650 gallons of chemical warfare agents, including lethal nerve gases, from 14 military posts to the Rocky Mountain Arsenal at Denver for disposal.The move is to take nlace within the next 10, days. The operation provoked protest in the Denver area when the Army first announced the disposal plan.The service conducted along environmental study and maintains the move will be safe.The agents, in obsolete training kits, will be flown into Denver's Stapleton International Airport near the arsenal.

title: Bridge:
description: A player who takes Kipling's advice and keeps his head can some times bring home contracts that appedr hopeless.South did so on the diagramed deal, from a rubber bridge game, and vindicated his partner's touching faith in his dummyplay skill.

title: Repairs on Chicago Elevated Line Are Rerouting 146,000 Riders Daily
description: CHICAGO, Jan.6Daily travel for 146,000 riders has been disrupted since the discovery of three cracks in supporting steel girders forced a halt to elevated and commuter train service along a busy onemile section of track south of the city's downtown area.

title: Detectives and Firemen Differ On Women in the Ranks
description: They'll do exactly What the men do. I can't see why they couldn't.I'm surprised it didn't happen long ago.

title: Business Records
description: BASILIDES BAEZ, 539 Soundview Ave., the Bronx.Liabill tics, 57,450; assets, none.

title: Big Board Seat Is Sold for $46,000
description: The New York Stock Exchange said yesterday that a membership on the exchange was sold for $46,000, up $1,000 from the preceding sale on Dec.30. Seats were quoted yesterday at $45,000 bid and $49,000 offered In an unrelated development, the Chicago Board Options Exchange announced that a seat on its exchange has been sold for $47,000, up $2,000 from the previous sale on Jan.4. The exchange's current seat market $46,000 bid and $48;500 offered.

title: No Penalty in Baltimore Gas Leak
description: BALTIMORE, Jan.6 (AP)The Procter & Gamble Company, at whose plant ruptured tank released a cloud of toxic gas that moved over Baltimore and driftrd into Pennsylvania on Wednesday night, will not be cited for the incident, Dr. Oneil M.Banks, who is in charge of occupational health matters for Maryland, says.He called the leak a very unusual freak accident. He said the company was not at fault and no regulations devised could have prevented it.

title: Looking At a World Strange And Tiny
description: Like spacecraft sending back pictures of some littleknown planet, scanning electron microscopes continue to reveal that, down among the very small creatures of this planet there is a realm of landscapes as otherworldly as any in space.It is a realm inhabited by strange and mysterious forms that, unlike those in space, indisputably represent life.

title: Michael Anderson Marries Jane Vern
description: Jane Vern, an instructor and supervisor in family therapy at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine, was married yesterday morning to Michael Anderson, an artist.Khoren Arisian performed the ceremony at the New York Society of Ethical Culture.

title: Bronx School Guard Is Accused of Raping Student,
description: A public:school security officer,in the Bronx was arrested yesterday and charged with the rape of a 15yearold girl who visited the school daily to pick up her younger brother and sister.

title: Top Federal Aides Meet for Discussion Of SeaRule Fight
description: WASHINGTON, Jan.6Highranking Carter Administration officials met at the White House today in an effort to resolve a dispute over whether the Environmental Protection Agency should begin enforcing a new law banning the dumping of oil and other materials within 200 miles of the nation's shores.

title: Blze in Harlem Hits Noted Cafe; Arson Is Likely
description: A landmark Harlem restaurant called Charles Gallery  formely Frank's Restaurantwas heavily damaged yesterday morning by a twoalarm fire that appeared to have been caused by arson, according to the polcie.

title: McGuire Names a New Chief of Police Operations
description: Police Commissioner Robert J.McGuire has selected William J.Devine, now one of 12 assistant chiefs in the Police Department, to be the new chief of operations.

title: Babe, a Buff Ascob, Judged Best Puppy
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., Jan.6PrimeTime Pistol Packin Mama, a buff Ascob with ring presence, won $444.80 as best puppy in a field of 180 entries tonight in the cocker spaniel national futurity at the American Spaniel Club's 61st specialty in the Holiday Inn Jetnnrt.

title: Efforts to SaveMusic Hall Started
description: Public and private efforts to save the Radio City Music Hall were started yesterday, with some government officials saying they were confident a way could be found to keep the historic tourist attraction open.

title: CARTER WARNS CHIEF OF FRENCH SOCIALISTS ON TIE TO COMMUNISTS
description: PARIS, Jan.6President Carter expressed his concern today to the French Socialist  leader, Francois Mitterrand. about the possibility that the Socialists political alliance with the Communist Party would be renewed, according to a White House official.

title: Recorder Found in India Crash;
description: BOMBAY, India, Jan.6 (Reuters)The Indian Navy has found the flight recorder of an Air India jet that crashed into the sea on New Year's Day killing all 213 people aboard, the Samachar News Agency said today.The recorder, discovered after an intensive search, could determine the cause of India's worst air disaster.

title: Events Today
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln Center, Strauss's Der Rosenkavaller, 1:30; Verdi's II Trovatore, 8.

title: Both Are Eligible to Return; Connors, Ramirez Victors
description: The focus of the Grand Prix Masters tennis competition shifted yesterday from the tennis court to the doctor's office when Guillermo Vilas and Bjorn Borg unexpectedly defaulted their last roundrobin matches.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BLUES IN THE NIGHT When Son Seals made one of his rare local appearances not long ago, Robert Palmer of The New York Times referred to the concert as an auspicious occasion.He wrote that the 35yearold performer, a native of Arkansas who now lives in Chicago, was the most exciting young blues guitarist and singer in years. Mr.Seals is returning here over the weekend in adoublebill concert atthe Bottom Line (2286300), We't Fourth Street and Mercer, that portends an interesting blues evening.Joining Mr. Seals and his quartet on the program, will be two more young Chicagoans who are already attracting attention on the blues scene with their recordings. They are Buddy Guy, blues guitarist and singer, and Junior Wells, on the harmonica, who are teamed for the second half of the bill.

title: ANDRUS MOVE DELAYS ENFORCING OF '02 LAW
description: WASHINGTON, Jan.6Cecil D.Andrus, the Secretary of Interior, said today that enforcement of a 1902 law limiting ownership of federally irrigated land in the West to 160 acres a family member would be delayed for at least a year while his department complied with a court ruling in a lawsuit that was brought to block the law.

title: Books of The Times Star Light, Star Bright
description: The Once and Future Star, by George Michanowsky. Hawthorn, 149 pages, $7.95.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: ST.LOUIS, Jan.6 (AP)The Monsanto Company has shut down indefinitely one of two acrylonitrile manufacturing plants at its Chocolate Bayou petrochemical complex near Alvin, Tex., the company said today.

title: ExPoliceman Assists in Capture
description: In their haste to leave a bank in the Canarsie section of Brooklyn, two men attracted the attention of a passing motorist who noticed that one of the men was carrying what looked like a pillowcase.

title: Miss Twainlev Would Have Liked This Article
description: HILLSDALE, N.Y.If you can get by the security guard and make it to the main office of almost any public secondary school in the city a few moments before the daily session ends, the chances are you'll see the &taff lined up eager to punch the timeclock and liberate themselves from the day's chores and the memory of their already released charges.It's a discouraging sight.I know of nothing that more visibly dramatizes one of the critical differences between yesterday's education and today's.

title: Cavanaugh of Pitt Plays Hiding Game
description: MOBILE, Ala., Jan.6Hiding from the ubiquitous agents is one of the game's the Senior Bowl football players have been playing here this week.

title: Poor Tribe in Palm Springs Plays White Man's Game and Prospers
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Jan.6 (AP)Ray Patencio is a young Indian who drives a Cadillac, wears modish glasses and tells Indian students to learn the white man's ways and beat him at his own game.

title: Atlantic City Votes to Keep Its Form of Government
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Jan.613y an unotncial margin of some 2,500 votes, Atlantic 1City today rejected in a referendum move to change the local form of government from the present City Commission, in existence since 1912, to a mayorcouncil setup.

title: Dow Slumps to 793.49, Lowest in 2 Years
description: Stock prices broke sharply yesterday as the Dow Jones industrial average plummeted almost a dozen points, to close at its lowest level in more than two years.

title: Deaths
description: McCAWVera.On January 5 1978 Wife of the late Raymond ???? 45 Years night editor of The New York Times.Reposing Albert R.Conne Funeral Home, 4955 Broadway (20 5t).Filneral Mass St.Elizabeth Church, Saturday 11 AM.

title: Dartmouth Hires Yukica As Head Football Coach
description: Joe Yukica, football coach at Boston College the last 10 years, accepted the coaching job at Dartmouth College yesterday, and, in effect, moved from one pressure situation to another.

title: MARY FOX RAU
description: Mary Fox Rau, mother of the Montreal Expos general manager, Charlie Fox, died yesterday in Westchester Square Hospital in the Bronx.She was 79 years old.

title: Letter: On Pretrial Hearings and the Press
description: To the Editor: Neither Tom Wicker's recent column (Immunity for Judges) nor the subsequent Times editorial (Covering Up the Trial Before the Trial.) does justice to the recent ruling of the New York Court of Appeals permitting the exclusion of the press from a pretrial hearing on the defendants motion in a murder case to suppress confessions and admissions claimed to be inadmissible in evidence against them because obtained by unconstitutional means.

title: NEW YORK STATE ADS AROUSING OPPOSITION
description: ALBANY, Jan.6Governor Carey's press secretary has ordered state agencies to clear all their display advertising through his office.The order was issued as a controversy boiled up over advertisements for the State Commerce Department that began appearing this week.

title: Television.
Bookmaking Raids Net Six Men Linked To Bonanno Family
description: Six alleged associates of the Joseph Bonanno crime family were arrested yesterday in a raid on three bookmaking wire rooms in Queens that the F.B.I.and the Brooklyn Organized Crime Strike Force said were doing $6, million a year in business.

title: Apolinar Calls on Own Songs
description: One of the compensations of composing good songs for the scores of shows that have not been produced or are virtually unknown is that, if the writer of the songs happens to be a singing pianist, he has a rich repertory of fresh material that is not being heard in every other piano bar in town.

title: Adolph Behrenberg, 63, Pastor Of a Church in Jersey 35 Years
description: The Rev.Dr.Adolph H.Behrenberg, for 35 years pastor of the First Presbyterian Church of Metuchen, N.J., died Dec.30 in a Plainfield (N.J.) nursing home.He was 63 years old.His residence was at 260 Woodbridge Avenue, Metuchen.

title: Israel Confirms Sinai Settlements
description: TEL AVIV, Jan.6Israel acknowledged today it was expanding its settlements in the occupied area of the Sinai Peninsula, which it has offered to restore to Eavot in a peace settlement.

title: Blast Wrecks 4 Apartments
description: ATLANTA, Jan.6 (UPI)An explosion attributed to a gas leak destroyed four apartments in a south Atlanta complex last night, injuring more than a dozen persons, none seriously.J.R.Pittman, a battalion chief for Atlanta's fire department, said that the explosion had probably been caused by a naturalgas leak.

title: Bail for Joan Little Is Denied by Justice in Brooklyn
description: A State Supreme Court justice in Brooklyn refused yesterday to set any bail for Joan Little, the 23yearold black woman who escaped from a North Carolina jail last October and was captured in Brooklyn last month.

title: Music: Gary Steigerwalt, Pianist
description: Gary Steigerwalt, who performed Thursday night at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A., is a young pianist who studied for eight years with the late Irwin Freundlich and whose accomplishments so far include second prize in the 1976 LisztBart6k International Piano Competition and performances with the National and Seattle Symphonies.

title: Detectives and Firemen Differ On Women in the Ranks
description: They'll do exactly what the men do. I can't see why they couldn't.I'm surprised it didn't happen long ago.

title: Reserve Lifts Its Bank Loan Rate; Stocks Off, Citibank Raises Prime
description: The Federal Reserve Board announced yesterday in Washington that it had approved an increase in the discount ratethe rate that it charges on loans to member commercial banksto 61/2 percent from 6 percent.

title: Sports Today
description: Harvard at Princeton, 8 P.M.

title: Looking At a World Strange And Tiny
description: Like spacecraft sending back pictures of some littleknown planet, scanning electron microscopes continue to reveal that down among the very small creatures of this planet there is a realm or landscapes as otherworldly as any in space.It is a realm inhabited by strange and mysterious forms that, unlike those in space, indisputably represent life.

title: Knicks Stop Bulls By 9997
description: CHICAGO, Jan.6The New York Knicks got 28 points from Bob McAdoo, including the final basket of the game, but it took almost the final minutes of scoreless basketball for them to emerge with a 9997 victory over the Bulls in the Chicago Stadium tonight.

title: Consumer.Notes Auto Liability Limit Not Expected to Cut Premiums
description: A bill signed into law yesterday by Governor Byrne, which limits to $75,000 an automobile insurance company's liability on any one medical expense claim, is expected to have little or no effect on reducing insurance premiums and, in some cases, could even increase costs to motorists.

title: Patents
description: WASHINGTONThe inventor of gauge patented this week believes will appeal to the millions of car and oat owners who do their own engine tuneups.

title: Miami Lawyer Gets Indeterminate Term For Bribing a Judge
description: Shaya Estrumsa, a Miami lawyer convicted in September of bribing a judge to lower the bail in a narcotics case, was sentenced yesterday to an indeterminate sentence of up to three years in orison.

title: De La Roche's Legal Rights at Issue
description: HACKENSACK, Jan.6Harry De La Roche Jr.'s defense attorney sought during the second day of the youth's murder trial today to build a case that investigators had deprived the defendant of) his legal rights to remain silent and to obtain an attorney.

title: Winter's Voices
description: The sounds of winter, or even the memory of them from days spent in the country, can set the cheeks to tingling: the whine of snow underfoot on a brittlecold day; the moan of night wind in a grove of hilltop hemlocks; the groan of ice on a lake or river when the temperature has flirted with zero for a solid week.

title: Of the Mule and The Thoroughbred
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala.7At the round table at the Diplomat Restaurant, where regulars hunched over their coffee like vultures in a treetop, the topic of discussion was The Big Game.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in the business/finance section of The Times yesterday incorrectly described the terms of a hid by Humana Inc.for American Medicorp Inc.The correct terms involve an offer by Humana to pay $15 in cash plus half of a $25 preferred share, or a total of $27.50, for each of 5.7 million American Medicorp shares.

title: Radio
description: 67 A.M., WNYCFM. Sancta et Immaculata Virginitas; O Magnum Mysterium, Gabrieli; Es wolit ein Maidlein Wasser hol'n; Asperges me, Senfi; Terpsichore Musarum, Caroubel.

title: Brazil's Next Leader, Rarely in Limelight
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan.6Although Gen.Joao Baptista de Oliveira Figueiredo, who was designated yesterday to succeed Gen.Ernesto Geisel as President of Brazil next year, has been at or near the center of power since the military coup of 1964, he has not been considered a public figure until now.As chief of the National Intelligence Service for the last four years, the threestar general has led a life that was necessarily discreet.And in an earlier post as head of the military staff of President Emilio G.Medici, he had reputation for inaccessibility.

title: New jersey Briefs
description: A 78yearold woman who won a court fight last week for the admin: istration of laetrile as her last hope of curing terminal colon cancer died Thursday at The Valley Hospital in Ridgewood several hours after the state Senate completed legislative ac; tion on a bill that would.legalize the sale and distribution of the drug in New Jersey.Governor Byrne said yes:: terday he would sign the measure: Relatives said the woman, Catherine B.Suenram of Hawthorne, had received at least three treatments with the controversial drug since a State Superior Court judge ruled that the hospital could not interferen with administration of the drug.During court arguments last week, family members said Mrs.Suenram had two weeks to live.

title: CARTER WARNS CHIEF OF FRENCH SOCIALISTS ON TIE TO COMMUNISTS
description: PARIS, Jan: 6President Carter ex pressed his concern today to the French Socialist leader, Francois Mitterrand. about the possibility that the Socialists' political alliance with the Communist Party would be renewed, according to a White House official.

title: The Recruiting Officer Staged in New Haven
description: NEW HAVENThe Long Wharf Theater production of The Recruiting Officer is not so much played as advanced, like a worthy cause.

title: Associated Press
description: MR.CARTER'S DAY: The President met in Paris with Francois Mitterrand, Socialist leader. Later, in Brussels, he was greeted by Belgium's King Baudouin. At right, Lillian Carter was on hand at White House in Washington to welcome her son home from his travels.

title: Memories of a Nazi Camp, Where a Musical Gift Meant Survival
description: ARCUEIL, FranceUsing a tiny, tattered notebook which she carried from her deportation to Auschwitz to her liberation from Bergen Belsen 15 months later, Fania Fenelon has written a memoir of life in the shadows of gas chambers and crematoriums, Playing for Time, released in the United States last fall.

title: 3 Quadruplets Breathe Normally
description: SAN ANTONIO, Jan.6 (AP)Three of the Tyson quadruplets born Tuesday night; were breathing on their own today while the fourth remained on a respirator, according to officials at the Wilford Hall Air Force Medical Center.Doctors said all four of the children born to Penelope Tyson, wife of Staff Sgt.Kenneth Tyson, remained in good condition and continued to improve.

title: SpasskyKorchnoi Adjournment
description: BELGRADE, Yugolavia, Jan.6 (AP)Boris Spassky and Victor Korchnoi adjourned the 16th game today in their match to determine who will meet, titleholder.Anatolv Karpov of the Soviet Union for the world chess championship later this year.Korchnoi, an expatriate Soviet grandmaster, leads 8 to 7.Spassky, a Soviet former world champion, lives in France with permission of the Soviet authorities.The adjourned game will be continued tomorrow.

title: COMMUNICATION SATELLITE LAUNCHED SUCCESSFULLY
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Jan.6 (UPI) A commercial communications satellite that can handle 6,000 telephone calls and two television channels at the same time rocketed into space tonight.The Intelsat IVA blasted off its launching pad at 7:15 P.M.atop an Atlas Centaur rocket. An identical satellite is to be launched in April.The last Atlas Centaur launch of an Intelsat IVA, on Sept.29, exploded 55 seconds after liftoff.The satellite launched tonight will replace two smaller Intelsat IV satellites.

title: Reports on Nearby Skiing Conditions
description: (Reports supplied by resort owners. Not all lifts operating).

title: Gift to Neediest Recalls a Crisis
description: The, bombing at La Guardia Airport during the 1975 Christmas holidays, in which 11 persons died and 75 others were dnjured, was recalled by a grateful survivor, in a card sent to the 66th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases.Fund.

title: Miller Successor Signals Change In Management Style at Textron
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Jan, 6Joseph B.Collinson, 63yearold president and chief operating officer of Textron Inc., was named today to succeed G.William Miller as chief executive.Mr.Miller was chosen last week by President Carter to head the Federal Reserve Board.

title: Armco Sees Price Plan Aiding Steel Industry Profits
description: C.William Verity, chairman of the Armco Steel Corporation, forecast yesterday that 1978 will definitely be a more profitable year for the steel industry and that domestic steel shipments could reach 99.3 million tons, which would make it the third best year in history for the industry.

title: New Coach for Southern U.
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Jan.5 (AP)Cass Jackson, the football coach at ivicrris Brown College, was picked as the new head coach of Southern Universify, Southern's president said today.Jackson, 34, will succeed Ken Tillage, who was Southern's interim coach the last part of the past season after Charlie Bates quit seven games into the season.

title: CandidatesWoo Jersey City's Mayor
description: JERSEY CITY, Jan.6Potential Democratic candidates for the United States Senate nomination are wooing Mayor Thomas F.X.Smith, who has become the most soughtafter political leader in New Jersey since he won the city election last May and took control of the Hudson County Democratic organization.

title: Chicago Judge Reported As a Possible Candidate For F.B.I.Directorship
description: WASHINGTON, Jan.6Justice Department officials confirmed tonight that Federal District Judge Frank J.McGarr was under consideration as a possible candidate for nomination as director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Sex Pistols Make United States Debut
description: ATLANTA, Jan, 6After weeks of confusion, capped by a visa controversy that was resolved only a few days ago, the Sex Pistols finally made their American debut last night at the Great South East Music Hall and Emporium, a 525seat halftheater, halfclub in a shopping center here.

title: Cambodia and VietnamAncient Enemies
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Jan.6How ever puzzling Cambodia's motivation may be for provoking a major military and diplomatic showdown with Vietnam, its powerful neighbor, there is no doubt that fundamental reasons do exist for confrontation between the two former allies.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O.Box 5193, Church Street Stadon, New York, N.Y.10249 or to these agencies:

title: Labor Trouble Looms at Aqueduct
description: The possibility of labor problems loomed over Aqueduct yesterday as maintenance menthose in charge of keeping racing strips in conditionreported they had scheduled a grievance meeting for Monday.

title: Begun Is Backed for Koch's House Seat by Beaxne and Former Mayor Wagner
description: In what has become a contest of per sonalities and endorsements, two former New York City Mayors, Abraham D. Beame and Robert F.Wagner, yesterday backed Martin S, Begun, for the Democratic nomination for the House of Representatives seat vacated by Mayor Koch.

title: About New York
description: If things went as might have been expected, in terms of life cycles, the Aufbau, a New York Germanlanguage newspaper that first came out in 1934, might today be just a fading memory of a fading readership that consisted largely of Germanspeaking Jewish refugees from Hitler's Europe.But things rarely go as expected.

title: Alert Is Sent Out By Safety Agency On Grain Elevators
description: WASHINGTON, Jan.6The Occupational Safety and Health Administration today issued a hazard alert to grain elevator operators urging them to act nuickly to prevent explosions of the kind that have killed more than 50 workers in recent weeks.

title: Japanese Data Show Tokyo Tried To Make World War II ABomb
description: Documents have come to light indicating for the first time that Japanese scienists were at work in World War II on an atomic bomb for use.against this country but were thwarted by air raids, lack of official coordination and funds, and the backwardness of atomic physics in Japan.

title: Hearing for Ron Lyle March 13
description: GOLDEN, Colo., Jan.6 (UPI)Judg6 James Zimmerman of County Court,has scheduled a preliminary hearing for March 13 to determine whether there probable cause to bind the heavyweight. boxer Ron Lyle over for trial on a change of seconddegree murder.The formal charge was filed yesterday by the chid deputy district attorney for Jeffersoz. County, Dan Fahrney.Mr.Lyle cused in the New Year's Eve shooting death of his former manager, Vernon Clark.

title: Associated Press
description: MR.CARTER'S DAY : The President met in Paris with Francois Mitterrand, Socialist leader. Later; in BriisselS; he was greeted by BelgiUm's King Baudouin. At right, Lillian Carter was on hand at White House in Washington to welcome her son home from his travels.

title: SCHLESINGER VISITS JACKSON TO ASK AID ON NATURAL GAS BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan.6Secretary of Energy James R.Schlesinger secretly flew to California this morning with handful of top energy officials to try to win support from Senator Henry M.JeaIson, Democrat of Washington, for a compromise on natural gas priring.

title: The Night Pro Tennis Arrived
description: In other years, tennis pros played Madison Square Garden between planes.Arrive, put up the court, play the match, take the money and run.Even so, the tennis often was spectacular.The dignity of the stage demanded dignity of performance.Pancho Gonzales, the old lion who probably has played more tennis in the Garden than anybody else, once said, I'm always frightened in the Garden; it's frightening to think you might have a bad match in the Garden. Not that he ever did.But no matter how good he was, he usually played one match and departed. That was the format then.Hello, goodbye, be back next year.And the one match did not have much significance other than being the opener of a tour of perhaps 50 onenight stands.A tour is not a tournament.But all that is changed now.Guillermo Vilas and Jimmy Connors changed it.Thursday night at the Grand Prix Masters in three hours of traumatic tennis that should assure the Garden of important tournaments in the future.

title: ExConvict Charged With Slaying Of Coed From Long IslandDec.9
description: COOPERSTOWN, N.Y., Jan.6 (UPI)1 Ricky Knapp, a parttime tree surgeon, was indicted today In the murder of Linda Velzy, an 18yearold Oneonta State College student.

title: TM New York TiMes
description: GOVERNOR MAKES DONATION: The day aftbr his divorce settlement, Gov.George C.Wallace of Alabama was asked to give again.At a Lions Club luncheon in Montgomery, he was jokingly fined a dollar for being the most important person there.Unable to come up with the fine, he was given the dollar by a member of audience, and as he threw it in the pot, said, This is my last dol. lar. His wife, Cornelia, received $75,000 in alimony.

title: John D.MacArthur,Billionaire, Dies
description: John D.MacArthur, the Florida insurance magnate and real estate billionaire, died of cancer early yesterday at Good Samaritan Hospital in West Palm Beach; Fla.He was 80 years old.

title: Dance: Duncan Works Restaged
description: Dealing with the ghosts of the past is no easy matter, but the performing company of the Committee for the Isadora Duncan Centenary did a creditable if imperfect job in this area Thursday night when it opened the 1978 Riverside Dance Festival at Riverside Church.

title: W.Sherman Burns Is Dead.at 86; A Pioneer in Industrial Security
description: W.Sherman Burns, retired chairman of PArns International, Security Services Inc., TO Briarcliff Manor, N.Y., died Thursday it a hospital in Sheridan, Wyo.He was 86 years old.

title: F.T.C.Calls Price Plan for Steel Costly, Pernicious Trade Curb
description: WASHINGTON, Jan.6A Federal Trade Commission staff report has severely criticized the Carter Administration's reference price plan to check steel impOrts, calling it a pernicious form of trade restriction that will cost American consumers more than $1 billion year.

title: News Summary
description: President Carter expressed his concern to the French Socialist leader, Francois Mitterrand, about the possibility that the Socialists alliance with the Communist Party would be renewed.The White House decision to publicize Mr. Carter's comment, made privately during a meeting with Mr.Mitterrand, represented an unexpected involvement in French politics, only 10 weeks before legislative elections that could bring the Socialists and Communists to power.[Page 1, Column 6.]

title: Companies List Earnings Reports
description: For periods ended Nov.30 unless otherwise Indicated.(N) Indicates stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) American Slog.k Exchange and (0) over.thecounter.

title: Ballet: Three Balanchine Parties
description: The three ballets by George Balanthine that the New York City Ballet presented Thursday night for the first time this season at the New York State Theater resemble three kinds of parties.

title: Tomjanovich to Miss, Remainder of Season
description: HOUSTON, Jan.6 (UPI)Rudy Tomjanovich, the Houston Rockets forward, said today he would miss the remainder of the season because of coMplications from massive facial damage he suffered four weeks ago.

title: Altman Chairman Denies Discussions Concerning Merger
description: John S.Burke, Jr., chairman of B.Altman & Company, denied yesterday that any merger negotiations had taken place with Marshall Field & Company, Chicago, or any other wouldbe purchaser of Alt. man in recent years.

title: Miss Nelspn Barely Beaten By Mrs.Moser in Downhill
description: PFRONTEN, West Germany, Jan.6 (AP)Annemarie ProellMoser of Austria edged Cindy Nelson of Lutsen, Minn.by a tenth of a second today to pick up her first World Cup downhill victory this season and first place in the standing.

title: KOCH ASSIGNS A CAR TO A THIRD CITY AIDE
description: Mayor Koch bestowed a third cityowned sedan on a member of his new administration yesterday, but he balked at assigning one to a State Supreme Court justice, asking him to offer better justification for his need.

title: Federal Land Banks Are Offering 2 Bond Issues at $1.37 Billion
description: The Federal Land Banks announced yesterday that they will offer two bond issues totaling $1.37 billion next Wednesday to refinance $995.6 million of maturing bonds and to raise $379.2 million of additional funds to make agricultural loans.

title: EXOFFICER OF REA ENTERS GUILTY PLEA
description: Richard Simpson, a former vice president of REA Express Inc., pleaded guilty yesterday to a Federal charge of conspiracy to embezzle more than $100,000 from the company, which was the nation's largest ground and air express service before it went into bankruptcy two years ago.

title: INDIANS LOSE IN COURT IN FIGHT TO GAIN LAND
description: BOSTON, Jan.6A Federal jury decided today that the Wampanoag Indians of the Cape Cod town of Mashpee were not a tribe on key legal dates of their history, thus balking the Indians claim to a vast tract of land in the town.

title: Associated Press
description: VANDALIZED REDWOODS ARE FELLED: Workmen at the Smithe State Redwood Reserve in Leggett, Calif., prepcm to cut down a 1,000yearold redwood, one of three found vandalized by chain saws.Trees were valued at $45,000; the largest of then was 12 fee.in diarnter and 250 feet tall.

title: Carter Visits NATO and Vows to Consult Allies on WeaponCurb Move
description: BRUSSELS, Jan.6President Carter promised European allies of the United States today that he would involve them increasingly in his efforts to negotiate new agreements limiting American and Soviet nuclear weapons.

title: 500,000 Cars Recalled By Ford and Chrysler
description: DETROIT, Jan.6The Ford Motor Company and the Chrysler Corporation today announced the recall of more than half a million cars.

title: Dollar Edges Downward in Europe But Keeps Most of Its Recent Gains
description: LONDON, Jan.6 (AP)  The dollar edged downward on the world's money markets today as President Carter assured European leaders the currency was basically sound.

title: The Proxmire Approximation
description: Senators Proxmire and Brooke, the ranking members of the Committee can Banking, Housing and Urban Affairs, recently took a cut at explaining New York City's financial problems to the President of the United States, in 13 singlespaced pages.The cut was most unkind.It suggested that solution of the problems is impeded now only by a failure of New York will.

title: OLGA KOUSSEV1TZKY, WIDOW OF CONDUCTOR
description: Olga Kousseyitzky, widow of Serge KiStfSsevitzky, conductor of the Boston Symphony Orchestra, died of a heart attack:.Thursday in her apartment at 30 West 60th Street.She was 76 years old.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in the business/finance section of The Times yesterday incorrectly described the terms of a hid by Humana Inc.for American Medicorp Inc.The correct terms involve an offer by Humana to pay $15 in cash plus half of a $25 preferred share, or a total of $27.50, for each of 5.7 million American Medicorp shares.

title: Dave Marash Leaves WCBSTV for ABC job
description: Dave Marash, who has been anchorman of WCBSTV's 11 P.M.newscast for nearly five years, has resigned to become a correspondent, based in New York.for ABC News.Mr.Marash said he was giving up the anchor position, coveted by most broadcast newsmen, because he wanted to return to straight reporting.

title: Study of New Parents Looks at the Impact Of Baby's Arrival On the Marriage
description: BERKELEY, Calif.A newborn baby may eat a lot, sleep a lot, be noisy or quiet or rambunctious, but for its mother and fatherif they are new parentsits mere presence leads to confusion and anxiety, doubt and depression.

title: S.C.I.Head Denies Effort to Embarrass State Police
description: TRENTON.Jan.6Joseph H.Rodriguez, chairman of the State Commission of Investigation, said today that efforts were under way to damage his agency and that he wanted a chance to refute testimony before the State Senate Jueiriary Connttee that it had been tryhig to embarrass the New Jersey  state nolice.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan.6A Federal Trade Commission staff report has severely criticized the Carter Administration's reference price plan to check steel imports, calling it a pernicious form of trade restriction that will cost American consumers more than $1 billion year.

description: Public and private efforts to save the Radio City Music Hall in Manhattan were started yesterday, with some government officials saying they were confident a way could be found to keep the historic tourist attraction theatre open.

title: Rancor Develops at Rhodesia Talks
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Jan.6 (Reuters) Negotiations between whites and blacks for a Rhodesian settlement have become deadlocked and taken on an acrimonious tone, with charges of deceit and concessions of racism, according to minutes of key private meetings.

description: DALLAS, Jan.6 (AP)  The Internal Revenue Service had moved collect the Super Bowl bonus of Craig Morton to help pay a $34,636 tax lien.

title: Personal Investing
description: As the nation's biggest retailer, Sears, Roebuck & Company is truly a chunk of America.Its millions of customers cut across every income line, and its more than $15 billion in sales account for more than 1.5 percent of the gross national product.

title: 3 U.S.ADMIRALS SEE, SOVIET NAVY THREAT
description: Three senior retired American admirals have warned that Soviet naval capabilities.have expanded to the point where they endanger American control of sea routes over which oil would reach the United States and reinforcements would move to Europe during a war.

title: The New York Times/John Solo
description: In Bronx Park Botanical Gardens yesterday, a police scuba unit held a demonstration for members of the force on various methods of rescuing victims from falls through thin ice.The demonstration included methods ranging from helicopter rescue, right, to simpler devices, such as laying a ladder from firm ice to the victim.

description: Astronomers believe that for the first time they have observed a star only moments, astronomically speaking, after its nuclear fires ignited.

title: Sun Life of Canada Plans To Move Its Head Office Following Language Rule
description: MONTREAL, Jan.6Canada's largest insurance company, the Sun Life, announced plans today to move its head office from Montreal to Toronto as a reaction to a new language law making French the primary language of Quebec.

title: Notes on People
description: Former Representative Wayne L. Hays, Democrat of Ohio, who was forced out of office beause of the Elizabeth Ray scandal, says he will try for a political comeback this year.I think it's likely that I'll run for something, he told The Cleveland Plain Dealer. Something probably will be either as a county commissioner or a state representative.Mr.Hays, 66 years old, lives on a 200acre farm in Belmont County, Ohio.He resigned from Congress in September 1976 after it was disclosed that Miss Ray was being paid by the House for doing little and was having an affair with him.

title: CARTER TOUR AROUSES CRITICISM IN EUROPE
description: BONN, Jan.6 (AP)President Carter's foreign tour drew low marks in some West.European newspapers while others praised his Middle East peace efforts. Some editorial critics of the sevennation swing said the patchquilt itinerary and wellpublicized gaffes confirmed suspicions of White House amateurism.

description: PHILAD;LPHIA ????? 3 (???).Kevin McDonald scored 30 points to lead the University.of Pennsylvania to an 8681 Ivy League victcry ever Ilarvard in college basketball Conight.

description: WYNNE, Ark., Jan. 7 (AP)  A tornado devastated a mobile home park here today,. killing two persons and destroying about 50 trailers, according to Cross County Civil Defense Director Art Rogers.

title: An OWL (Older Wiser. Learner) in College
description: DENVER IWAS overdressed. My fellow freshnen at the University of Arizona were in Tshirts and sandals. My pantsuit was more appropriate for my status as a mature student. No one else was wearing makeup.

title: For a Wintertime Project, How About A New Stone Wall?
description: Tim Currier of Newtown, Conn., is a dry stone craftsman who builds walls in much the same way that men have built walls for centuries. He selects a rock, studies it briefly, then drops it accurately into position. He uses no mortar or cement. In a dry wall, gravity is the glue that holds each rock in place.

title: Lynn Sims Is Engaged
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Albert H. Sims of Bayside, Queens, of the engagement of their daughter, Lynn Sims, to William Jacobs, son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel A. Jacobs of Rego Park, Queens. A summer wedding is planned.

description: This intergalactic ShangriLa, reporter called it once, but last week it seemed like a dead star disappearing into a black hole.

title: A Loose Grip On Tax Cuts
description: WASHINGTON Al Ullman plugs away at one of the most important jobs in Congress. As chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, a position he took in 1975 as the winds of change blew through the House, he presides over a disparate committee that is not easily controlled at a time when tough issues, from energy to tax revision to health insurance, are falling in his jurisdiction.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: WHEN cutting thin strips of wood, metal or, plastic, it is often difficult to get a smooth cut because even finetooth saw blades tend to grab and the thin material tends to bend (in the case of metal) or splinter (in the case of wood). One of the easiest ways to solve this is to sandwich the material being cut between two scrap pieces of olvwood or wood.

title: Parolee Is Sent Back To Get False Teeth
description: PHOENIX, Jan. 7 (AP)Federal has ordered state. officials to return John J. Cratt back to prison to be fitted for a new set of.false teeth.

description: EASTCH ESTER SPEAK Out Against Child Abuse, a coalition of women trained by Westchester County and New York State professionals to inform residents about the detection, prevention and reporting of child abuse, has formed a speaker's bureau to familiarize Westchester residents with ways to deal with the problem.

description: Use sand, fertilizer or kitty litter on icy walks and drives, not salt which damages roots of grass and ornamentals. Start geranium seed indoors for garden plants to set out in May.
