title: Chile Bars a Swedish Lawyer
description: STOCKHOLM, Jan. 19 (Reuters)The head of an international group investigating alleged crimes by the military ggovernment of Chile was from entering the country by officials at Santiago's airport, the gswedish oforeign Ministry said today. The group's leader, HansGoeran Franck, a Swedish lawyer, had planned to spend a week meeting with political leaders and relatives of political prisoners.

title: Broadway
description: DAVID MAMET'S The Water Engine is moving from the Public Theater to the Plymouth Theater on Feb. 28, and while Joseph Papp has moved productions uptown from downtown before, he has never done it with so much panache. The Water Engine is about a young inventor, threatened and assaulted by venal industrialists who are trying to destroy his invention an automobile engine that runs on water. The play is performed as a radio drama, with the actors speaking into 1934 microphones, and the critics thought it was fine. It is, however, only about an hour long. For the move to Broadway, therefore, Mr. Papp asked Mr. Mamet to write something else to go with it. Mr. Mamet is doing it now. There is something marvelous about this.

title: N.A.A.C.P. Calls for Total Pullout By U.S. Businesses in South Africa
description: The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People has decided to call for the total withdrawal of American businesses from South Africa because of that Government's policies of racial separation.

title: Mental Patient Steals Ambulance And Injures Brooklyn Pedestrian
description: A 28yearold mental patient allegedly escaped from St. Vincent Hospital in Greenwich Vilage yesterday morning, jumped into an ambulance and took a terrified blind woman on a wild noontime ride to Brooklyn that ended only after the vehicle reportedly swerved onto the sidewalk at Flatbush Avenue and Cortelyou Road and gravely injured a 60yearold woman.

title: CORRECTION
description: A report in the company earnings table in the business/finance section of The Times yesterday incorrectly attributed the earnings figures of the Great Lakes Recreation Company to the Great Lakes Chemical Corporation. The corrected report for Great Lakes Recreation is in today's earnings table. The two companies are unrelated.

title: Bridge Collapses in India
description: NEW DELHI, India, Jan. 19 (AP)A section of a bridge under construction about 600 miles southeast of here collapsed today and about 70 workers were feared dead, the Indian news agency Samachar reported.

title: Hartford CaveIn Still a Mystery
description: Why did the 1,400 tons of steel that spanned the roof of the Hartford Civic Center's coliseum suddenly collapse on Wednesday, just hours after 5,000 people had been in the building?

title: Mathews Is Voted Into Hall
description: Eddie Mathews, who began his baseball career hitting his mother's pitches in a Santa Barbara, Calif., schoolyard, was voted into the Hall of Fame yesterday in his fifth year of eligibility.

title: Knicks Lose 5th in Row As Suns Score, 134114
description: PHOENIX, Jan. 19The Phoenix Suns, blitzing the Knicks at the start of each period, rolled to a 134114t riumph before a crowd of 10,935 tonight.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Drovers National Bank Declared Insolvent
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19The Comptroller of the Currency declared the Drovers National Bank of Chicago insolvent tonight, one of the nation's oldest national banks and the fourthlargest American bank to fail in recent years.

title: Money
description: THURSDAY, JANUARY 19, 1978

title: Comptroller Criticizes Citicorp For Stock Repurchase Program
description: WASPINGTON, Jan. 19The Comptroller of the Currency has criticized Citicorp, the n??tion's Fccondlargest banking concern, for shrinking its capital base through a stock repurchase program that was just completed.

title: Stocks Fall in Cautious Trading; Dow Is Off 7.63 Points to 778.67
description: Stock prices dropped yesterday as an air of caution pervoded Well prior to President Carter's State of the Union Message scheduled for delivery last night. DuPont and Allied Chemical.

title: Precious Metals Futures Are Up Soybeans Drop by 1c in Chicago
description: After dropping on Wednesday, prices of precious metals rebounded yesterday both here and In Chicago. Evidently, traders expected that President Carter's State of the Union Message would be favorable.

title: DE LAROCHE TESTIFIES BROTHER WAS KILLER
description: HACKENSACK, Jan. 19Harry De La Roche Jr. testified today at his murder trial that he shot his brother repeatdly after returning home from a discotheque and finding his parents shot to death and his youngest brother, Eric, dying in a pool of blood on his bed.

title: BARNES IS SENTENCED TO LIFE IN DRUG CASE
description: Leroy (Nicky) Barnes was sentenced yesterday to life in prison on a Federal charge that he headed a Harlem organization described by the prosecutor as the largest, most profitable and most venal drug ring In New York City.

title: JUDGE MARVIN M. BERGER DIES NEAR COURT IN QUEENS
description: Judge Marvin M. Berger of the Criminal Court in Queens died of a heart attack Wednesday night on Queens Boulevard near the courthouse in Kew Gardens. He was 69 years old and lived in Jamaica Estates, Queens.

title: Pentagon May Buy Trucks and Buses At German Plants
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 19 (AP)The Pentagon is weighing a politically sensitive decision on a proposal to buy up to 7,400 West Germanmade trucks, buses and other vehicles for United States milltarv forces in Europe.

title: SCHMIDT REBUFFS U.S. ANEW ON CALLS TO SPUR ECONOMY
description: BONN, Jan. 19Chancellor Helmut Schmidt again brushed aside today calls from the United States for West Germany to expand its economy and thus stimulate international trade. Advocates of this theory on how to promote world economic growth overrated the power of the German economy, he said.

title: Bank Earnings for Quarter
description: For periods ended Dec.31. (N) indicates stock Is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: Gomez Retains Ring Title on ThirdRound Knockout
description: KITAKYUSHU CITY, Japan, Jan. 19 (AP)Unbeaten Wilfredo Gomez of Puerto Rico knocked out Royal Kobayashi of Japan in the third round tonight and retained the World Boxing Council iunior featherweight title.

title: Letter: On Disability and Retirement
description: To the Editor:

title: Market Place
description: A decade ago, the American Broadcasting Companies owned the third television network in what was known as a twoandahalfnetwork economy.

title: Tongsun Park Again Plays Host for Influence's Sake
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Friday, Jan. 20The candlelight from the two silvermounted hurric#ne lamps flickered over the faces of Tongsun Park's guests as the South Korean millionaire, a renowned Washington host, explained the difficulties of underEoine a nolveraoh test.

title: Dividends
description: THURSDAY, JANUARY 19, 1978

title: Fortune Poises Its Baton Over a Young Conductor
description: A few years ago, when Calvin Simmons was an assistant conductor of the San Francisco Opera, he was invited by the Los Angeles Philharmonic to conduct a children's concert. At the end of the rehearsal for the event, he was offered the ExxonArts Endowment assistant conductor's post he currently occupies.

title: Crosby Tourney Victim of Rain
description: PERBIE BEACH, Calif., Jan. 19 (AP  Heavy overnight rain flooded portions of the Monterey Peninsula today and forced postponement of the first round of the $225,000 Bing Crosby National ProAm golf tournament.

title: VANCE MEETS BEGIN, GETS CLARIFICATIONS ON PEACE POSITIONS
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 19Secretary of State Cyrus R..Varge obtained clarifications today from Prime Minister Menahem Begin on Middle East peace issues, with the hope that these clarifications would help to persuade President Anwar elSadat to send the Egyptian delegation back to peace talks here.

title: Burden May Go to Court to Force Recount in Race With Mrs. A bzug
description: Carter Burden, who lost the Democratic nomination in the I Sth Congressional trict to Bella S. Abzug in a courtroom Wednesday, threatened yesterday to go back to court to force a recount of last Sunday's balloting.

title: Dance: Five Directors Infuse Greenhouse Ensemble With Wit
description: THE Greenhouse Dance Ensemhle has come a long way since it first blossomed out from the Erick Hawkins Dance Company five yeare ago.

title: Carter Proclaims Heart Month
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (AP)President Carter today proclaimed February as American Heart Month in accordance with a resolution adopted by Congress in 1963 asking the President to designate February as Heart Month each year.

title: DeMilia Seeks Talk With Homosexuals
description: The president of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association said yesterday that he would invite all homosexual officers on the New York City police force to meet with him privately to discuss the union's position on Mayor Koch's expected executive order prohibiting city departments and agencies from discriminating against homosexuals.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Jan. 20, 1978 GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: New York School Official Says He Hired 114 Teachers Either Improperly or Illegally
description: The executive director of personnel for New York City's public schools, Frank C. Arricale 2d, told members of the State Assembly's Education Committee yesterday that his office hired 114 teachers either improperly or illegally last year.

title: MONEY SUPPLY FELL SHARPLY FOR WEEK
description: The nation's money supply declined sharply in the week ended Jan. 11, but its contraction is unlikely to last long, figures released by the Federal Reserve indicated yesterday.

title: Koch's Man Dispossesses Beame RealEstate Official
description: Stephen Fisher, deputy commissioner in charge of New York City's Real Estate Management Division, arrived Wednesday at City Hall in his chauffeurdriven city car. He ran to a Board of Estimate meeting, while his driver raced to the men's room. When the driver returned to where he had parked, the car had disappeared.

title: Boston College Chooses Chlebek as Football Coach
description: CHESTNUT HILL, Mass., Jan. 19Ed Chlebek, a quarterback for the New York Jets in 1963 and 1964 and for the last two years head football coach at Eastern Michigan University, was named head coach at Boston College today.

title: Events and Openings
description: Friday Theater

title: Thomas E. Mullaney
description: WASHINGTONWhen he leaves office this summer after completing fiveyear term as managing director of the International Monetary Fund, H. Johannes Witteveen hopes to have solid commitments from member naThe Economic Scene tions for two pending enlargements of the fund's financing facilities that he deems vital to its future operations. One of the projects. so identified with his tenure at the helm of the international financing organization that it has been labeled the Witteveen Facility, is to aid nations with balanceofpayments tn.oblems arising principally out of the high cost of imported energy.

title: CARTER SAYS ENERGY, ECONOMY AND PANAMA ARE 1978'S PRIORITIES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19Calling for a new. partnership between those of us who lead and those who elect, President Carter tonight listed his Administration's priorities for 1978 as a strong energy bill, a coordinated economic program and Senate approval of the Panama Canal treaties.

title: STATE DEPT. AIDE CHOSEN AMBASSADOR TO POLAND
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (AP)President Carter said today that he would nominate William E. Schaufele Jr. to be Ambassador to Poland, replacing Richard T. Davies, who resigned.

title: Study Finds New York Favorable For Women Seeking Career Gains
description: New York City provides a favorable environment for women who want careers with wider opportunities in professions and management and better pay than women can generally find across the country, according to a comprehensive report made public yesterday.

title: Books of The Times
description: WHAT makes this book so much fun is that in the person of Otto Muck, a man very much of the 20th century, we have the nicest sort of 19thcentury German intellectual boondoggling. In Muck are conjoined thepedantic and the rhapsodic, plumbing and dreaming, It is as if one of the Mothers in Part 11 of Faust had taken up lepidoptery or toy soldiers. (One thinks. in fact, of Goethe's painstaking and wrongheaded theories on color vision. One also thinks, gloomily, of Spenglerian rirse cycles.) The professor, his pockets full of notes, playing Eflat major on a bass bassoon, sinks with the burning barge into the bloody Rhine, only this time the Rhine is the Atlantic Ocean. Wagner should have been there. pedantic and the rhapsodic, plumbing and dreaming, It is as if one of the Mothers in Part 11 of Faust had taken up lepidoptery or toy soldiers. (One thinks. in fact, of Goethe's painstaking and wrongheaded theories on color vision. One also thinks, gloomily, of Spenglerian rirse cycles.) The professor, his pockets full of notes, playing Eflat major on a bass bassoon, sinks with the burning barge into the bloody Rhine, only this time the Rhine is the Atlantic Ocean. Wagner should have been there.

title: Wheat Growers Show Mood Similar to Striking Farmers'
description: WICHITA, Kan., Jan. 19This was a far cry from Honolulu, farmers said as they gathered for this year's wheat convention.

title: Big Board and Amex Show Declines in Short Interest for the Month
description: The New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday that short interest fell 2.3 million shares in the month ended Jan. 13 to 33 million shares. The interest for the yearearlier level totaled 26.9 million shares.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: Stage: James Earl Jones as Robeson
description: THE INTENTION WAS to bring the life of Paul Robeson to the stage. he stage of the LuntFontanne heater is very wide, but last night it rarely seemed like more than a podium.

title: Levitt Calls Koch Demagogic on the Pension Issue
description: The New York State Comptroller, Arthur Levitt, said yesterday that Mayor Koch's castigating him for refusing to invest state pension funds in city bonds was demagogic and irresponsible nonsense.

title: VANCE MEETS BEGIN, GETS CLARIFICATIONS ON PEACE POSITIONS
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 19Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance obtained clarifications today from Prime Minister Menahem Begin on Middle East peace issues, with the hope that these clarifications would help to persuade. President Anwar elSadat to send the Egyptian delegation back to peace talks here.

title: World News Briefs
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 19 (Reuters)The Soviet Union, in the first major revision of travel rules in more than 10 years, has added more than 20 towns and cities to the list of areas open to foreigners, Western diplomats said today.

title: Carter Cites Humphrey Zest
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19 (UPI)President Carter ended his State of the Union speech tonight by urging the nation to pattern itself after the life of Senator Hubert H. Humphrey. The President said that Mr. Humphrey, who died last Friday, exemplified the joy and zest of living and that his death reminds us not so much of our own mortality but of the possibilities offered to us by life.

title: Article 4 -- No Title
Art: Charting A Jagged Terrain
description: STEPHEN BUCKLEY at 33 is one of the front runners of English painting. He is in every official mixed show, he is in all the uptodate histories of modern English art, and he is one of the two or three painters who are recommended to every inquiring foreign visitor.

title: Block Island Council's Approval Of Deer Hunting Season Is Denied
description: NEW SHOREHAM, R.I., Jan. 19 (AP)A member of the Block Island Town tCouncil today disputed reports that the council had approved a hunting season to reduce the island's deer population.

title: Article 2 -- No Title
Surgery for 2 More Cowboys
description: MUENSTER, Tex., Jan. 19 (UPI) Team doctors performed surgery on two more members of the Super Bowl champion Dallas Cowboys today, removing cartilage from the right knee of John Fitzgerald, center, and a small growth from the foot of Randy Hughes, a safety. Both were listed in good condition after the operations.

title: WestinghouseManila Deal Studied
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation said yesterday that it had been informed by the Department of Justice and the Securities and Exchange Commission that they were investigating its contract to build a nuclear power plant in the Philippines.

title: The Pop Life
description: WINILLIE NELSON and Waylon Jennings were in town this week, a bit bleary from an allnight Dallas Cowboys celebration in New Orleans after the Super Bowl, but otherwise talkativeBoth Texans, they had performed at the party, and among their selections was their latest hit, a duet called Mamas Don't Let Your Babies Grow Up to Be Cowboys. Mr. Jennings allowed as how he was a little apprehensive about singing that song in that context, but patched things up by inserting a hurried unless they want to be football players in the appropriate spots.

title: New York Urban League Sees Growing Racial Unrest
description: Contending that relations between blacks and whites in New York City are at their worst level in 20 years, the New York Urban League warned yesterday that, without such measures as more jobs for. black youths and a lessening of tension between white policemen and nonwhite residents, the situation could become explosive.

title: Two Couples Help Neediest Cases In Similar Ways Set Up Years Ago
description: Two New York City couples devised similar plans 15 years ago to benefit the annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Deaths
description: AMISANOAndy.A giant among hardhats; a man with a heart of gold whose bark was bigger than his bite; a mentor and friend for decades to many sandhogs; his vast experience and knowledge of tunnel construction will be sorely missed by many friends in the heavy construction field. To Ann and his children and grandchildren, we extend our heartfelt sympathy. He will always be in our hearts, Andy.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Notre Dame 70, Villanova 69
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Jan. 19 (UPI)Don Williams made two free throws with four seconds left tonight to give Notre Dame a 3point lead, and the Irish emerged with a 7069 victory over villanova in a college basketball game.

title: CORRECTION
description: A report in the company earnings table in the business/finance section of The Times yesterday incorrectly attributed the earnings figures of the Great Lakes Recreation Company to the Great Lakes Chemical Corporation, The corrected report for Great. Lakes Recreation is in today's earnings table. The two companies are unrelated.

title: Reporting Morality
description: WASHINGTONJody Powell, who has been Jimmy Carter's chief interpreter for more than eight years, was asked late in the 1976 campaign how the news media had treated the religious aspects of Mr. Carter's life.

title: A Cautious F.B.I. Nominee
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19William H. Webster, the Federal appellate judge in St. Louis who was named today to become the third Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, says he can clearly remember just when he really became interested in the criminal justice process.

title: Major Messages Set Over Next Few Days
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 19President Carter's State of the Union Message tonight is the first of several major messages that he will deliver to Congress over the next several days.

title: ANDREOTTI IS ASKED TO FORM NEW REGIME
description: ROME, Jan. 19  President Giovanni Leone tonight asked Giulio Andreotti, who offered his resignation as Prime Minister Monday, to attempt to form another Government. Mr. Andreotti agreed to try, but said he realized the difficulties of the task.

title: Study of Ice May Yield Way to Gauge Solar Activity
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19A way to measure the levels of solar activity over the last several hundred thousand years may have been found In analysis of successive ice layers excavated at the South Pole.

title: A Variety of Corporations Report Operating Results, Disclosing Their Sales and Earnings Figures
description: For periods ended Dec. 31 unless otherwise indicated. (N) indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange,( A) the American Stock Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: Pardee Quits as Bears' Coach; Will Apply for Redskins' Post
description: Jack Pardee resigned yesterday as head coach of the Chicago Bears on the heels of George Allen's dismissal as coach and general manager of the Washington Redskins the previous night. Pardee, who had played and coached for Allen in Los Angeles and Washington, said he would immediately apply for the Redskin job.

title: Reserve Report
Feast From the Mind's Eye of Stuart Davis
description: STUART DAVIS (18941964) is one of the classic figures in the history of modern painting in America, a familiar and appealing presence in museum collections the country overyet how much do we really know about him as an artist? After seeing the exhibition called Stuart Davis: Art and Art Theory, opening tomorrow at the Brooklyn Museum, we are likely to conclude that we never really gauged this artist's true quality of mind. This is an uncommonly interesting as well as a very beautiful show of a painter who not only produced stunning picturesthat much we have long knownbut also. plotted his intellectual course with a systematic seriousness and intensity that will be a revelation to many people already familiar with his painting.

title: Dollar Falls Lower Abroad; Gold Up
description: The dollar drifted generally lower in nervous trading in European and New York foreignexchange markets yesterday in advance of President Carter's State of the Union message, the Associated Press reported.

title: LloydCarr Put in Receivership
description: BOSTON, Jan. 19Federal Judge Joseph L. Tauro today ordered the national commodities option firm of Lloyd, Carr & Company into receivership and consolidated all court actions pending against the firm under the jurisdiction of the Massachusetts Federal District Court.

title: Opera: Beverly Sills
description: BEVERLY SILLS and Sherrill Mines sang the leading roles in Massenet's Thas at the San Francisco Opera two years ago, and that was the production seen Wednesday night at the Metropolitan Opera. Thais has been out of the Metropolitan reportory since 1939. There seemed no great public groundswell for a revival. But Beverly Sills is a diva, and divas must have their vehicles. Hence Thas.

title: CARL BETZ, 56, DIES; ACTOR ON STAGE, TV
description: Carl Betz, the stage, film and television actor who was best known for his portrayal of the father in television's The Donna Reed Show and as the lawyer in Judd for the Defense, died Wednesday in Los Angeles at the CedarSinai Medical Center, where he had been hospitalized since late last November with lung cancer. He was 56 years old and lived in Malibu, Calif.

title: Reaction to Message Is Tepid On Both Sides of Congress Aisle
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19  Congress reacted with only limited enthusiasm to President Carter's State of the Union speech tonight as members indicated that their support or opposition to various proposals crossed party lines.

title: CARL OLSON, 84, COACHED PITTSBURGH TRACK TEAM
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan, 19Carl Olson, a former University of Pittsburgh track coach who also helped coach American Olympic teams, died yesterday in Columbia Hospital here. He was 84 years old.

title: Vermont Plans Ski Insurance
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Jan. 19Gov. Richard A. Snelling took steps today to establish a program that would allow Vermont's multimilliondollar ski industry to insure itself against future ski injury suits.

title: Carter, in State of Union Address, Appeals for Canal Pacts' Approval
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19  President Carter appealed tonight for ratification of the Panama Canal treaties to. demonstrate our good faith to the world and to discourage the spread of hostile ideologies in the Western Hemisphere.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
Court Disbars Troy At Bar Unit's Urging For Guilt in Felony
description: Former City Councilman Matthew J. Troy Jr. was disbarred yesterday by the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn.

title: Enough!
description: Aren't you getting sick and tired of these saviors who want to ban this and that and everything else?

title: A Cautious F.B.I. Nominee
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 19William H. Webster, the Federal appellate judge in St. Louis who was named today to become the third Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, says he can clearly remember just when he really became interested in the criminal justice process.

title: Cavs 117, 76ers 109
description: RICHFIELD, Ohio, Jan. 19 (AP)Elmore Smith, in his first starting assignment of the season, scored 27 points to pace the Cleveland Cavaliers to a 117109 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers tonight, ending the 76ers' ninegame winning string.

title: The Very Rev. Hamlet Accorsi, ExHead of Missionary Society
description: The Very Rev. Hamlet Accorsi, former Provincial Superior of the Verona Fathers Missionary Society in the United States and in Italy, died Jan. 12 at Mountainside Hospital in Montclair, N.J., after a long illness. He was 74 years old and lived at the society's mission center at 88 High Street in Montclair.

title: Barnes Draws LifeWithout Parole As Harlem DrugRing Operator
description: Leroy (Nicky) Barnes. described by the prosecutor as the leader of the largest. most profitable and most venal drug ring in New York City, was sentenced yesterday to life in prison.

title: Southern Illinois Five Upsets Indiana State
description: CARBONDALE, III., Jan. 19 (UPI}Southern Illinois hit 70 percent from the floor and nine from the freethrow line m the second half to upset previously unbeaten Indiana State, 7976, in a Missouri Valley Conference basketball game tonight.

title: They'll Gavotte All Night at Tully Hall
description: Dance, as the 16thcentury dancing master Thoinot Arbeau put it, is mute rhetoric. Trained as the 20thcentury eye is in the esoteric discipline of classical ballet, audiences today come to early dance forms with expectations that may be satisfied by the stylizations of Renaissance dance, for example, but are often disappointed in the lack of a familiar virtuosity. But starting with a concert by Terpsichore and its affiliate, the Ensemble for Early Music, at Alice Tully Hall at 8 P.M. on Sunday, New Yorkers will have a chance to explore the rhetoric of other days in a program called Renaissance Revels, Italy, 15801640.

title: Blood Shortage Is Said to Delay Operations in Metropolitan Area
description: The metropolitan region is in the midst of a seridus blood crisis that has depleted supplies and curtailed operations at scores of hospitals, according to Dr. Robert L Hirsch, the Greater New York Blood Program's medical director.

title: Metropolitan Baedeker
description: YONKERS, which calls itself the City of Gracious Living, has fallen on hard timescash is in short supply, the neighborhood is changing, and the municipal family is a bit restless. But the city has wavered before and recovered. Like one of the dowagers in the Victorian mansions that still overlook the Hudson River, it has a rich history as well as the difficulties of age. Sections of the city have fallen into disrepair or disappeared altogether, to be replaced by the barren towers of modern housing. But many interesting areas and structures remain, and some are fascinating reminders of a city that still offers much.

title: Where to Savor Tea for Two on a Winter Afternoon
The Bronx Will Relive Colonial Siege in Park
description: A reenactment of the siege of Fort Independence, fought in 1777, win br staged in Van Cortlandt Park, the Bronx, at the Van Cortlandt Mansion, Broadway, north of 242d Street, on Sunday from 11 A.M. to 3 P.M.

title: Stacking the Deck in Southern Africa
description: When South Africa's Parliament convenes next week, Prime Minister John Vorster is likely to announce plans for granting rapid independence, under black leadership, to Namibia (SouthWest Africa), the former German colony which Pretoria has run for half a century. In Rhodesia, an announcement of a similar sort may come soon from the white minority Government of Ian Smith, which has been negotiating with three black leaders for the coming of majority rule.

title: MUSTO SAYS WITNESS WAS COACHED TO LIE
description: NEWARK, Jan. 19Lawyers for State; Senator William V. Musto and four codefendants said today that they had evi1 Bence the Government's key witness had been coached to lie that he had witnessed payments to them to protect an illegal gambling operation in Union City.

title: Machinist Scores By Nose in Dash
description: StuAl Stable's Machinist won a stretch duel with Cruise On In in capturing the $25,000 T.V. Lark Purse yesterday at Aqueduct.

title: COURT DISBARS TROY FOR GUILT IN FELONY
description: Former City Councilman Matthew J. Troy Jr. was disbarred yesterday by the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn.

title: Restaurants
description: As its name suggests, Pirandello is a dramatically theatrical setting for Italian food, and it seems on its way to a twostar rating. Opened since June, on the corner of Washington Place and Mercer Street in Greenwich Village, this charming dining place is distinguished by lofty, white walls, lots of leafgreen trim, hanging plants, a smart blackandwhite checked floor and airy, crisp white halfcurtains and slatted blinds. As cheerful as a greenhouse by day, it becomes dramatic after dark, when a clever lighting arrangement casts romantic shadows on the walls.

title: Harold Medina, at 8 9, Still Loves Law, Columbia and Telling Stories
description: In the glareless light of a bookjammed study 24 floors above Foley Square, a distinguished old judge wearing tweeds, galluses and a green bow tie is drafting an opinion that has grown now to 37 pages. Snow, the color of his hair and his toothbrush mustache, flies by the windows he works against a selfimposed deadline of Feb. 16, the 90th anniversary of his birth.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Jasper Johns and Robert Motherwell are to be seen in their studios, and there is Christo in his own version of an atelierthe Australian coastline. The three artists, filmed at work, are the subjects of a triplebill tonight at 8:30 at the Aldrich Museum of Contemporary Art in Ridgefield, Conn. The Jasper Johns film, which coincides with the museum's show of his screen prints, shows Mr. Johns working on his Decoy lithograph. Iri the Motherwell film, the artist is producing an edition of aquatints. And in Christo's cinematic appearance, he is wrapping a mile of the Sidney, Australia, coast with a million square feet of woven propylene, banded by 35 miles of rope. Admission is $2. Call (203) 4386482 or (203) 4384519 for reservations. From New York City, take the Saw Mill River Parkway to U.S. 684; continue to route 35 and follow it east to 258 Main Street in Ridgefield.

title: New Face: Lonette McKee Another Shade of Black
description: The moviegoer may like to think that good looks and the ability to act, write music, sing, play the piano and dance are all that a young woman needs to aspire to be a successful actress. But often, it isn't enough; the right complexion helps.

title: A Street Singer Wins at Last
description: When Geraldine Fitzgerald describes the program she sings at Reno Sweeney at midnight tonight and tomorrow as street songs, she is not referring to the songs that street singers such as London's buskers might sing. Her street songs are the songs that she sings when she is walking the streets. although she is no longer as open about it as she was when she first arrived here from Ireland.

title: South and Midwest Battered by Storms
description: Twin winter storms swept across the nation yesterday, spreading a crippling glaze of snow, ice and sleet in the South and bringing a new round of heavy snows to portions of the Middle West.

title: News Summary
description: FRIDAY, JANUARY 20, 1978

title: Harold Medina, at 89, Still Loves Law, Columbia and Telling Stories
description: In the glareless light of a hookjammed study 24 floors above Foley Square, a distinguished old judge wearing tweeds, galluses and a green bow tie is drafting an opinion that has grown now to 37 pages. Snow, the color of his hair and his toothbrush mustache, flies by the windows he works against a selfimposed deadline of Feb. 16, the 90th anniversary of his birth.

title: Oklahoma State Draws 2Year Probation in Football
description: MISSION, Kan., Jan. 19 (AP)The National Collegiate Athletic Association placed Oklahoma State University on a twoyear football probation today for recruiting violations.

title: Tammy Grimes Tries Another Molly
description: I felt I was never going to get to the soul of the person, and that was very frightening. Tammy Grimes, who doesn't give the impression of being easily frightened, was talking earnestly the other day about the character she plays in Molly, the new play by Simon Gray that opens tonight at the Hudson Guild Theater and in which she has the title role.

title: German Papers Are Struck
description: FRANKFURT, Jan. 19 (Reuters)Journalists and printers at several West German newspapers struck today over the introduction of computer technology. The, printers demanded that no jobs be lost by the introduction of computerized typesetting, and the journalists said they should not be compelled to use videoscreen editing techniques.

title: Possible Fault Called on Use of Grand Slam Title
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Jan. 19The Grand Slam is back in the news in tennis.

title: U.S. Nordic Ski Team Gets Financial Support
description: The United States Nordic ski team, which has never been highly competitive in international events, expects to benefit from a threeyear, $1 million program sponsored by Fleischmann's Margarine. The program, designed to support crosscountry skiing ana jumping at both competitive and participatory levels, is intended to improve American performances at the winter Olympics in 1980 at Lake Placid, N.Y.

title: Architecture: Fast Food Changes Tastes
description: WHILE good citizens' groups battle on to keep McDonaid's golden arches and Mobil's rounded gas pumps out of sight, a growing segment of the architectural community is singing their Praises. For some time now it has been fashionable, at least in certain circles, to defend the sort of architecture that one could once dismiss with the single word schlock.

title: Flyers 1, Canadiens
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 19 (AP)Steve Shutt's secondperiod goal, combined with finalperiod pressure saves by Ken Dryden, enabled the Montreal Canadiens to salvage a 11 tie tonight with the Philadelphia Flyers in a bruising matchun of the top two N.H.L. teams.

title: Art: Casting Space in a Different Light
description: LIKENING Government and corporations to the merchant princess of the Renaissance continues to be a popular clich. Yet it is becoming more obvious that modernists are not so much patronized as cooptedperhaps unwittinglyand not by bodies but by an abstractionprogress. Persuaded of their autonomy by complex art philosophines, artists take, in the name of individualism, the banal and ugly side effects of technology and make them palatable, interesting or amusing. This is done not so much by transforming them as by placing them in an art context. Thus presented, they are accepted by an audience that, in any other circumstances, would recoil from them.

title: S.C.I. Asks Penalties for Abuses Found in Schools for Handicapped
description: TRENTON, Jan. 19The State Commission of Investigation recommended today that civil suits and possibly criminal charges be brought against operators of private schools who may have abused the $26 millionayear state program to educate severely handicapped children.

title: Indiana 77, Ohio State 63
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Jan. 19 (UPI) Wayne Radford scored 8 straight points in the first four minutes of the second half tonight to lead Indiana to a 7763 victory over Ohio State in a Big Ten game.

title: At the Movies
description: NEVER having been married, Jill Clayburgh has never had to get a divorce, which is the subject matter of her latest film, An Unmarried Woman. Nor, for that matter, is she particularly familiar with the art world of SoHo, where her role has her working in a gallery before and after her marital breakup.

title: Islanders Down flues, 30, but Focus on Flyers
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan, 19You can't beat the Islanders for perfect timing. No doubt thinking ahead to Saturday's big matchup with the Philadelphia Flyers, the Islanders found goals almost impotssible to get against tonight's opponents, the St. Louis Blues, before finally beating them, 30.

title: Creamer Lois Gets Knomark Business
description: Creamer Lois FSR, which apparently is no longer using the oblique stroke in its namenot too important in the big picture, reallyhas picked up the Knomark account The means it will be doing advertising for such things as TyDBol bathroom products, Esquire shoe polish, Tintex fabric tints and dyes, and fabric softeners.

title: Music: Kubelik Leads Mahler's Ninth
description: MAHLER'S Ninth Sympathy is the clock of the universe winding down, a contemplation of an eternity in which man's pretensions and vanities are inexorably draining away to nithingness. The Ninth's Adagio finale, if you listen to it properly, can be one of the most frightening moments in all of Western art: Mahler's terrible vision of pure, mindless entropy. A conductor with the imagination to realize this can build the symphony throughout its hourand20odd minutes so that the last movement is almost unbearably painful.

title: New Estimate on OilLeak Size
description: TIVERTON, R.I., Jan. 19 (AP)From 500 to 3.000 gallons of heavy engine oil leaked from a tanker last week and are still floating in Mount Hope Bay, according to the State Water Quality Division. The new figure is considerably higher than the original Coast Guard estimate of 100 to 200 gallons. The new estimates came after some Tiverton residents charged that the Coast Guard had misrepresented the extent of the damage.

title: Bridge:
description: New York enthusiasts who favor team events have a considerable choice this weekend.

title: Wagner Favors Using Westway Fund to Rebuild IRT
description: Robert F. Wagner Jr., chairman of the City Planning Commission, has told Mayor Koch that money for masstransit construction should be used to rebuild and rehabilitate existing subway lines rather than to build new ones.

title: Profits Scoreboard
description: (Some of the major companies reporting yesterday)

title: Strike Grounds Olympic Airways
description: ATHENS, Tan, 19 (Reuters)All Olympic Airways planes were grounded today because of a strike by air hostesses, stewards and flight engineers, who are seeking better working conditions. About 900 employees of Greece's stateowned airline are taking port in the 48hour strike.

title: Exoort Prices on Scotch to Rise
description: LONDON, Jan. 19 (AP)Distillers Company Ltd., said today it would raise its Export prices on Scotch exported in blttles to the United States by 10 to 12 percent on Feb. 1. The increase was the first since January 1974. Distillers Company bottles Johnnie Walker, Dewar's, Haig, Pinch, Vat 69, Black & White and White Horse Scotzh. In a related development, the Scotch Whiskey Association said industry exports in 1977 rose by 17 percent to a record $991.2 million.

description: LOUISVILLE. Ky., Jan. 19 (AP)Scott May hit 10 of 12 field goals and all seven of his foul shots tonight to lead Chicago to a 10595 victory over Atlanta.

description: JOHANNESBURG, Jan. 19  Henry Ford, rebutting the arguments of antiapartheid militants, said at a news conference here today that his company can do more for the people of South Africa by staying than by withdrawing as part of an international effort to force the collapse of the country's racial policies.

title: Pearson Sets Record, Wins Pole at Riverside
description: RIVERSIDE, Calif., Jan. 20 (AP)David Pearson established a onelap record at Riverside nternational Raceway today while winning the pole position for the Western 500 NASCAR race.

title: Koch Proposes 4 Years of Cuts; Seeks More Aid
description: Mayor Koch said yesterday that he would reduce New York City's work force by 20,000 jobs over the next four years, hold down wage increases for the remaining workers and cut other expenditures, but he said he would still have to have major new state and Federal aid to close a budget gap of $457 million next year and increasing amounts in the following years.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Why Ethiopians and Somalis Are Fighting
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Jan. 20The conflict between Somalia and Ethiopia has become a matter of growing international interest and concern. The Soviet Union and Cuba are deeply committed to Ethiopia; Iran and Saudi Arabia are supporting Somalia and have appealed to the Carter Administrationso far unsuccessfullyto counter the Soviet bloc's initiatives on the Horn of Africa more positively.

title: Imports of Japanese C.B. Radios Ruled a Threat to U.S. Concerns
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 (UPI)The governmental International Trade Commission ruled today that it increased imports of Citizens Band radios from Japan. Taiwan, Hong Kong and South Korea constituted a serious threat to C.B. radio producers in the United States.

title: BRITAIN'S REVIVAL RAISES CONFIDENCE
description: LONDON, Jan. 20The dramatic revival in British finances has raised confidence to the point where borrowers in the international market are able to sell bonds redeemable in sterling.

description: Americans have become obsessed about what constitutes a healthy diet, a leading nutritionist says. So much so, they have begun to believe that anything with a nutritional label on it is nutritious.

description: To the Editor:

Two hundred twenty competitors and sonic outside donors combined to produce $2,400 for Nick Pepe of Floral Park, Queens, a quadriplegic who was recently deprived, as a result of bureaucratic confusion, of the New York City funds to which he is entitled.

While separate but equal may have been required when male faculties and trustees invariably resisted the arguments of early educational feminists, today it appears archaic, indeed faintly reprehensible.

The modem theater at the Fashion Institute of Technology has for several years been the staging ground for seventh Avenue collections. Albert Capraro, who has been a fan ever since the theater was opened, introduced his summer collection there, as students mingled with store buyers and the press in the audience. Located on Seventh Avenue, about half a mile south of the heart of the garment center, the school has become a favorite rendezvous for fashion presentations.

The average price paid for the shares was about $19.50 for a total expenditure of about $39 million. The board will consider whether to extend the program at its next meeting, the company said.

description: TOKYO, Jan. 20Japan had a record trade surplus of $9.75 billion on a customsclearance basis In 1977, nearly double the previous record of $5.12 billion registered in 1972, the Finance Ministry announced today.

And the Kenyan star, who had traveled all day from the University of Texas at El Paso, where he is a student, promptly stepped out on the track and ran away from a stormdecimated field in the time of 4 minutes 310ths of a second.

description: (Reports are suplied by Resort owners. Conditions subject to change.)

title: ALBANY IS EXPECTED TO RESIST KOCH PLAN
description: Mayor Koch's fouryear financial plan asks for $433 million in new, essentially unrestricted state aid to help the city close its budget gap this yearmore than twice the amount believed to be in the budget Governor Carey presented earlier thie week.

description: Yesterday's snowstorm caused the cancellation of the horseracing programs at the three major tracks operating in the metropolitan New York area, severely curtailed offtrack wagering on Florida races and convinced the Offtrack Betting Corporation to close for the weekend.

title: City Ballet Offers Calcium Light Night
description: Fun. That's the word for Peter Martin's very first ballet, which had its official premiere Thursday night with the New York City Ballet at the New York State Theater. Is it good? Yes, it is.

title: Bill Evans Dance Troupe Starts Brief Season at Pace University
description: Bill Evans is an ingratiating performer, as are the members of the Bill Evans Dance Company of Seattle, which opened a threeperformance season at Pace University's Schimmel Center on Thursday. Mr. Evans is a choreographer willing to try his hand at a staggering variety of dance subjects and moods. But the end effect, at least on Thursday's ambitious program of six dances, is choreographic scattershot.

title: Davis Cup Match Halted
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 20 (AP)A doubles match between India and New Zealand in the Davis Cup Eastern Zone semifinals was stopped today because of darkness with the teams tied at two sets and two games apiece.

title: How to Aid Your Health and Other Storm Tips
description: Yesterday's was the first blizzard in years to strike the metropolitan area, but according to the Farmer's Almanac, the harsh winter has only begun. There are, however, ways to cope. Whether you stay at home or venture into the cold, here are some tips that should be kept in mind.

title: 2,650 Sanitationmen Battle Snow; One Dies on Plow
description: I kissed my wife and each of my eight sleeping children this morning, 'cause I may not see them again until May, said John O'Keefe, a sanitation maintenance worker who had been shoveling snow in front of the Sanitation Department's building at 125 Worth Street and other buildings in the area since 4 A.M. yesterday. My youngest kid will probably be walking by the time I get back home.

title: World News Briefs
description: ROME, Jan. 20Prime Ministerdesignate Giulio Andreotti was instructed by the leadership of his Christian Democratic Party today to seek an accommodation with the Communists short of their direct participation in his proposed new government.

title: Escaped Lion Shot in Italy
description: NAPLES, Jan. 20 (Reuters)A lion was shot dead today after it escaped from its cage during a circus performance here. It ignored efforts to coax it back to its cage and was shot twice as it walked slowly toward the audience of several hundred people.

title: Television
Meditations on a Winter Cabin
description: ST. CLOUD, MinnFor most of the last four years, I have lived in a 15by30foot rustic cabin in northwestern Minnesota. When winter comes, the conversation often focuses on the weather, and cold temperatures are not considered just a passing fancy.

title: Stocks Edge Lower as Exchanges Open Up at Noon, Two Hours Late
description: Stock prices edged lower yesterday in an abbreviated trading session that saw both the New York Stock Exchange and the American Stock Exchange open at noontwo hours latebecause of a severe snowstorm.

title: People and Business
description: Goldman, Sachs & Company, a leading investment banking and brokerage firm, announced yesterday that it has retained Henry A. Kissinger, former Secretary of State, as a parttime adviser and consultant.

title: Jacques Brel Alive and Well Returns in Anniversary Visit
description: Jacques Brel Is Alive and Well and Living in Paris, which gave its first performance on Jan. 22, 1968, at the Village Gate will celebrate the 10th anniversary of that Openine tomorrow evening at Town Hill. The anniversary is part of a series of eight performances that began Thursday evening and will continue next week, from Wednesday through Sunday.

title: Chase to Figure Interest Costs On Joint Credit Card Balances
description: The Chase Manhattan bank has agreed to combine the balances of customers holding both Visa and Mastercharge credit cards when it computes interest charges. A result could be savings for some customers.

title: Despite BitterWords, Peace Is Mideast Goal
description: ANKARA, Jan. 20President Anwar el Sadat's meeting today with Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance near Cairo underscored the ambiguity of current Middle East diplomacy.

title: 'Mado,' a Film On Business And Pleasure
description: "Mado" runs two hours and 10 minutes and feels interminable, but it still seems like only half a movie. Director Claude Sautet, a man able to devote his full attention to the tiniest of issues, takes pains to explain those things he shows us, but the movie has no guiding spirit or identifiable raison d'tre. Nothing about it really commands the attention.Mado, (Ottavia Piccolo) the young woman of the title, is sullen and indecipherable, so it's just as well that her importance to the film is relatively slight. She has two groups of acquaintances, working-class kids and older, prosperous businessmen, and we are made to understand that she hires herself out to members of the latter group because members of the former are out of work. Mado only sleeps around enough to support herself, and she doesn't buy anything she doesn't need; also, she doesn't behave this way for pleasure, because she doesn't like anybody. This isn't sex, it's economic reality.One of Mado's well-heeled admirers is Simon. (Michel Piccoli) a wealthy land developer, and it's Simon and his business that most of the film is about. Much of the plot centers around a real-estate deal, and there is a certain amount to be surmised from watching the businessmen's manners and mores. Soon enough, though, the inherent excitement of the real-estate deal begins to pall, and all that remain are vague but somehow familiar observations about the bourgeoisie.Every now and then, Mado reappears to hammer home some comparison between free spirits and captive ones. In one scene, for example, Simon tries to make some coffee but is annoyed to learn that he can't operate his fancy new coffee machine. Then Mado leans over and gives the thing a twist, and it works perfectly. Sacre bleu!The performances by Piccoll, Charles Denner (as one of Mado's beaux) and Romy Schneider (as an alcoholic in love with Piccoli) are unexpectedly moving, especially since one seldom knows why any of these characters is behaving as he or she behaves. Mr. Piccoli's role is terribly ill-defined, but he manages to give a general impression of concern.Mr. Sautet's ending for the film is much more interesting than the slush that precedes it. Mado's two groups of friends begin to resemble one another, and to drift together, until they all wind up making an expedition to look over an important parcel of building lots (for the businessmen) and a ramshackle old farm (for the hippies). Then the party heads home, but a rainstorm and a traffic jam induce them all to leave the main road. They wind up knee-deep in mud in the countryside and it is there that everyone does something or other to reflect his or her true nature. The whole episode has the feeling of a failed Robert Altman movie as seen through a very thick fog.

title: Republicans Turning to Conable As Their Spokesman in Congress
description: WASHINGTON  Although he is in his seventh term in Congress, he still gets mail addressed to Barbara. And some of the letters come from women's rights groups as if he's one of them, an aide says. Representative Barber B. Conable Jr. of upstate New York is not rankled by it. He has been accustomed for a long time to the barbarizing of his name.

title: Electric Utilities Eye Coal Stock And Fear Cutback to Customers
description: It hasn't reached the emergency stage yet, but some electric utilities are beginning to squirm as their coal supplies dwindle to worrisome levels. The coal strike, now in its sixth week, has badly dented utility stockpiles in a string of states arcing from Virginia through the industrial Middle West to Kansas.

title: Heat in Buenos Aires Brin4s Vacation Exodus
description: BUENOS AIRES, Jan, 20Argentine concern over a border dispute with Chile was beginning to rise when President Jorge Rafael Videla interrupted his summer holiday and returned to his offices in this sweltering capital.

title: The Rains Came, but the Spirit of Sacrifice Remains
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., Jan. 19  The end of water rationing and the twoyear drought in Marin County are being greeted more with sighs of relief than with loud expressions of joy.

title: Air Cargo Giant Prospers in Spite of Strife in Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 20I'm ready to take on El Al anytime; if they didn't get Government subsidies, they'd be selling shirts.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
Dance Concert
description: Performers standing in place of remaining seated for long periods in dance concert raises an audience's anticipation level, but their doing so for an entire concert passes beyond the point of artistic return. Sun Ock Lee's program Thursday evening consisted of a collection of vignettes, several of which were effective, but all of which were static in the extreme. The company appeared at her studio theater at 105 East 16th Street.

title: Storm Met 3 Criteria Of Blizzard at Times
description: The term blizzard, according to the National Weather Service, is a rather general term, but should meet three basic criteria. There must be snow either falling or blown about, visibility of under a quartermile and winds above 35 miles an hours.

title: Varied Fare at Health Fair
description: The World's Fair of Health, which opened at Madison Square Garden on Thursday, perfectly illustrates the nation's current compulsive concern for personal health and wellbeing. Everything from liquefied garlic to pyramid power is being hawked in a circuslike atmophere there this weekend and next. Visitors can down nitritefree hot dogs, natural ice cream and ginseng tea, or pay 50 cents to have their blood pressure checked or $5 for a mini psychic healing. They can hear about the latest in water purifiers and motorized dough kneaders and purchase dog food free of preservatives, artificial flavorings, synthetic sweeteners, artificial colors and chemical additives.

title: Websters, Father and Son, Offer Concert at Tully Hall
description: Fatherandson performing teams on the concert stage are rare enough to be of special invest, and thus the appearance of Beveridge and Michael Webster at Alice Tully Hall on Thursday night made for something more than just another event in the musical life of a big city.

title: ARMY TO ASSIST E.P.A. ON SEWAGE PROJECT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20The Army Corps of Engineers this year will begin to help the Environmental Protection Ageny oversee the construction of some 4,000 sewage treatment plants that are to improve the quality of merica's polluted waters.

title: Power Cut Off in Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Jan. 20 (UPI)Saboteurs sawed through a transmission tower at Barranquitas in central Puerto Rico today in another incident involving a strike by 6,200 workers of the Governmentowned light and power company. description: ROME, Jan. 20The Italian police announced today that they had arrested a F'ranciscan priest, a former high police officer, a retired civil servant, a shipowner and nine other wellplaced persons on sharges of having helped kidnappers dispose of ransom money so it could not be traced.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20American officials and representatives of four West European countries will meet here tomorrow to discuss the EthiopianSomali conflict, the State Department announced today.

description: ATLANTA, Jan. 20Bert Lance was back in his natural element tonighttalking money and politics with people who count.

It has revived the American Basketball Association's 3point shooting area. And it appears to be reliving the growing pains both those leagues experienced.

description: Businesses and financial institutions in the metropolitan area closed down or sharply reduced operations yesterday as a driving snowstorm that blanketed the Northeast prevented executives and employees from reaching their offices and kept customers at home.

title: Coal Talks Held in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 (UPI)Talks aimed at ending the sixweekold coal strike were held here today, but there was no disclosure of what reaction United Mine Workers officials had to a wage package offered by the soft coal industry. Sources said the industry had offered the miners an increase of $1.43 an hour over three years, plus a costofliving adjustment. When the strike began on Dec. 6, union miners earned a top scale wage of about $8 an hour.

The report yesterday from Peoria, Ill., also showed the 1977 net up 16.1 percent.

description: Music

title: WILLIAM HENRY DUDLEY 3d
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 20 (UPI)William Henry Dudley 3d, who won an Olympic gold medal 30 years ago, died of an apparent heart attack yesterday. He was 47 years old.

description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 20Westchester and Rockland Counties came to a virtual halt today as heavy winds and sleet coinpounded the difficulties created by heavy overnight snowfalls. Residents stayed home, shoveling out driveways and relying on local radio stations or the telephone for information.

title: An Election WellDelayed
description: New brooms are supposed to sweep clean and the young Koch administration should be taking a careful look at the effectiveness of New York City's antipoverty programs. But it can't. Though it clearly wants to do so, it finds a rigid Federal hand holding back the broomstick.

description: Joseph Wald, a clothing manufacturer, died yesterday at his retirement home in North Miami Beach, Fla. He was 79 years old.

description: Gilbert Higbet, classicist, scholar, critic, poet, author and educator, died at New York Hospital yesterday of cancer. He was 71 years old.

title: Jamaica and the U.S.
description: In 1962, when we attained independence, a Jamaican leader would probably have begun a discussion on United StatesJamaican relations with a dissertation on the investment opportunities in Jamaica for adventurous United States capital.

description: The Boston team of Phil Stockton and A. O. Brooks advanaced to the semifinal round of the United States Open Court Tennis doubles championship by beating the New York team of Joe Crane and Tom Greevy, 6.5, yesterday at the New York Racquet and Tennis Club. The Philadelphia team of Jim Burke and William Vogt Jr. advanced by beating the New york team of Peter Hannen and Robert Pilkington by 63, 64.

description: Man in the News

title: Borg Victor Over Gottfried, 62, 64
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Jan. 20They were supposed to have met at Madison Square Garden two weeks ago, but Bjorn Borg turned up sick. Today, looking tanned and fit and playing on the surface he loves best, clay, the 21-yearold Borg routed Brian Gottfried, 62, 64, for a spot in Sunday's final of the $250,000 Grand Slam tennis competition.

title: HUNDREDS STRANDED ON SUBWAY IN BOSTON
description: Hundreds of riders stranded after a subway crash in Boston yesterday hid to be sheltered for the day in a subwaycar shop while city officials tried to Had food for them. It was the second subway crash there in three days.

title: Jersey Prison Aide Named
description: TRENTON, Jan. 19 (AP)The appointment of Margot Eld,. superintendent of the Correctional Institution for Women at Clinton, N. J., as executive assistant to Acting Corrections Commissioner William H. Fauver was announced by the New Jersey Department of Corrections yesterday. The department also announced the appointment of S. Phil Dwyer, assistant superintendent at Leesburg State Prison, as superintendent at Clinton.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of a transmission error, the middle name of the nominee to head the Federal Bureau of Investigation was given incorrectly yesterday in a Man in the News article. He is William Hedgcock Webster.

title: Oster, The Dean, Me And My Children
description: LATTINGTOWN HARBOR, N.Y.My daughter is 16 and she is beautiful. She is quite serene compared to her siblings. That the three of us live in such comparative harmony suggests that she is an only child.

title: Notes on People
description: The French police are looking for Garry Davis, the selfproclaimed world citizen, after his conviction in Mulhouse, near the Swiss border, on charges of selling false world passports. After his trial in absentia he was sentenced yesterday to two years in prison and a $1,000 fine. Mr. Davis, who renounced his American citizenship to become a world citizen after World War II, had been living in France and Switzerland and in 1971 began selling world passports issued by him in Basel. The authorities in France contended that some of the passports had been purchased by immigrant laborers who believed them to be official documents permitting them to stay in France. That led to charges of counterfeiting passports and swindling against Mr. Davis.

title: News Summary
description: SATURDAY, JANUARY 21, 1978

title: SADAT REBUFFS VANCE ON TALKS BUT VOWS PEACE DOOR IS OPEN
description: CAIRO, Jan. 20Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance was unable today to persuade President Anwar elSadat to send his negotiators back to the disrupted peace talks in Jerusalem, but he did obtain a pledge from the Egyptian leader that the door to peace is not closed.

title: Deaths
description: ALGERMartia Joseph. age 87, of Tucson, Arizona and Lake Placid. N.Y.on January 20M after a long illness. Survived by a daughter. Sybil Alger Pickett of BrceurvIlle, N.Y.. a son, Martin JAlger, Jr. of Watertown. N.Y., 7 grandchildren and 11 great grandchildren. Memorial service in Tucson at a later datell. In lieu of flowers contributions may be made In his memory to the St.Ellzabeth of Hungary Clinic. Tucson, Arizona.

title: Carroll Takes Responsibility for Missing $86,187 Funds
description: Robert F. Carroll Jr., who resigned this week as vice president of City College during an investigation of the disappearance of $86,187 from the funds of a national educational lobby he worked for, said yesterday that he was liable for the money.

title: Panel Finds No Blame In Death
description: Bob Vorhies's death was not the result of wrongdoing on the part of anyone connected with Virginia Tech, a special grand jury concluded yesterday. The freshman fullback from Irvingtong, N.J., died Nov. 21 following a punishment drill administered by an assistant football coach.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MUSIC, MUSIC, MUSIC Has anybody heard lately an accordion version of Rachmaninoff's famous Prelude in C sharp minor? This is part of the free program today at 2:30 P.M. at the Lincoln Center Museum Library, ill Amsterdam Avenue. The artist is Sergei

title: Ethiopians in Prague for Talks
description: PRAGUE. Jan. 20A senior Ethiopian Government delegation has begun talks with top Czechoslovak officials that many Western and African diplomats believe could lead to arms sales to the Ethiopians.

title: CONSUMER PRICE RISE PUT AT 6.8% FOR YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20Despite a Mowing of the inflation rate in December, consumer prices rose by 6.8 percent in 1977 as against 4.8 percent in 1976, the Government reported today.

title: Hanoi in New Threat to Cambodia
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Jan. 20Vietnam said today that Cambodia was leaving it no choice but to resort to legitimate selfdefense and righteous counteractions in the border warfare between the Communist neighbors.

title: Jersey Is Effectively Closed for the Day
description: New Jersey was virtually immobilized by yesterday's snowstorm and Governor Byrne appealed by radio to businessmen and other state residents to remain at home.

title: Highlights of State of Union Address and Message to Congress
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 20Because distribution of The New York Times was curtailed today due to a snow storm, highlights of President Carter's State of the Union address and of a special message to Congress that accompanied it are recapitulated here:

title: Greeks React Cautiously to Hopeful Signs on Cyprus
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Jan. 20While the climate for solving the Cyprus problem seems to be improving, with Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance's visit to Ankara and Athens being one of the signs, Greeks view recent developments with a mixture of cynicism spawned by past disappointments, suspicion that Washington and Ankara may be conspiring against them, and hope that at last the time for a settlement has come.

title: ANKER DENIES A BIAS IN PUPIL SUSPENSIONS
description: Chancellor Irving Anker of the New York City school system yesterday denied the Federal Government's assertions that minoritygroup students in the schools were suspended at a higher rate and for longer periods than other students committine the same offenses.

title: Nightmare in California: A Reporter's Story of Her Rape
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 20Carolyn Craven was a straight, sober television newswoman, not the sort to style herself an activist reporter. She kept personal and professional issues in separate spheres, she said.

title: Duran and DeJesus Fight for Undisputed Title
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Jag. 20Roberto Duran and Esteban DeJesus meet tomorrow for the third time in a 15rounder to decide the undisputed world lightweight boxing championship. The fight at Caesars Palace will he shown live in New York on Channel 2 at 4:30 P.M.

title: Moroccan King Praises Sadat For Firmness Against Israelis
description: RABAT. Morocco, Jan. 20 (Agence FrancePresse)King Hassan Ii of Morocco congratulated President Anwar elSadat of Egypt today for what he called firmness in the face of Israeli pretentions.

title: Brood Supplies in New York Area Are Critically Low in Snowstorm
description: Blood supplies in New York City and its suburbs, already depleted because of an unusually high number of influenza cases, were at record and critically low levels yesterday, officials said, as the snowstorm wiped out the possibility of replenishing blood banks.

title: Cooperstown Needs Firemen
description: By reputation, the relief pitcher is baseball's fireman. When the game is there to be saved or to go up in flames, he arrives at the mound. Once he trudged out of the bull pen and across the outfield grass with the defiant dignity that enhances the image of his role. Now he is usually delivered in an auto or a golf cart that emphasizes his importance. The good ones are cheered and saluted for their valor. Occasionally, one is rewarded with the Cy Young Award, as Sparky Lyle of the New York Yankees was last year. In the freeagent auction several have attained instant wealth Rich Gossage with the Yankees for $2.7 million over six years, Rollie Fingers with the San Diego Padres for $1.6 million over five years, Rawly Eastwick with the Yankees for $1.2 million over five years, Bill Campbell with the Boston Red Sox for $1 million over five years. But they are no more important to their teams than other relief pitchers were in the past. For years, managers contended that they could not manipulate their teams to a pennant without a fireman. Now they say they can not do it without two. Everybody in baseball understands the importance of the firemen, but there are none in the Hall of Fame at Cooperstown.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: We Did a Rotten Job This Time, National Weather Service Admits
description: The 13inch snowfall, yesterday embarrassed the forecasters at the National Weather. Service, who had predicted Thursday night that the storm would not bring more than three inches of snow to the metropolitan area.

title: $95.20 Bit of Sunshine Wins On Disqualifications
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Jan. 20 (UPI)Bit of Sunshine, a long shot ridded by Don Pierce, was third to finish in the Santa Anita feature today but was awarded the victory on a double disqualification and paid $95.20, $24 and $9.40 for $2 across the board.

title: Patents
description: WASHINGTONEquipment patented this week compares spoken words with those in an electronically stored vocabulary and, when the match is close enough, gives a command to a computer, an office machine or even a wheelchair.

title: Soviet Launches a Capsule With supplies to Keep Astronauts in Space
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 20The Soviet Union sent an unmanned capsule into space today with supplies and new equipment for the Salyut 6 orbital station and its twoman crew, who are now expected to remain aboard for a long stay.

title: Watson 3 Ahead With a 66
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Jan. 20 (AP) Tom Watson, who used a victory in this event as the springboard to 1977 player of the year honors, sloshed his way to a sixunderpar 66 and the firstround lead today in the raindelayed.$225,000 Bing Crosby National ProAm golf tournament.

title: Public Duty, Private Jobs
description: As public awareness of alarming minority unemployment rates sinks in, almost everyone has come to agree on the public duty to create jobs for those who need and hunger for them. The only question has been, who should create them, government or industry? The answer the Nixon and Ford Administrations was, oddly, Government. Both pushed C.E.T.A. jobs, federally funded publicservice jobs named for the Comprehensive Employment Training Act that created them.

title: Freighter Disappears Off Africa
description: TOKYO, Jan. 20 (Reuters)A freighter bound for Nigeria with Japanese goods valued at $4.2 million has disappeared off the West African coast, a paper reported today. The daily Yomiuri, quoting Japanese shipping agents, said nothing had been heard from the 12,000ton Panamanianregistered freighter, Chief S.B. Bakare, since it left Ghana on Dec. 19 bound for Lagos. The coast off Nigeria was the scene last year of a number of armed attacks by pirates on cargo vessels.

title: Jesse Jackson Tells Receptive G.O.P. It Can Pick Up Votes of Blacks
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 20Blacks will vote Republican if Republicans will go after their votes and look after their interests, the Rev. Jesse L. Jackson told the Republican National Committee today.

title: It's the Great White Way
description: It was as pure as new fallen, as white as driven, as chaste as unsunned. No matter how you sliced it, it was snow. There were snow men and snow women, snow plows and snow shovels, snow balls and snow cones, snow mobiles and snow birds, snow skiers and snow haters. People wore snow boots and snow suits and snow shoes. For some it was no problem, for others no fun.

title: World Cup Downhill Skiing: Walcher Wins by .07 Seconds
description: KITZBUEHEL, Austria. Jan. 20 (AP) Josef Walcher won the World Cup downhill today in one of the closest ski races ever staged on the famed Streif Trail.

title: Raymond Steiner, Chief Officer Of Sony of America, Is Dead
description: Raymond Steiner, the president of the Sony Corporation of America died in Tokyo yesterday. He was 50 years old and was a residend of Woodcliff Lake, N.J.

title: Women Find Squeeze in Squash
description: Women's spuash racquets competitionhas come a long way, baby, but there still is not enough money in it to induce an amateur to turn pro. And so Margaret Zachariah continues going her relatively satisfying way as the Australian amateur champion, seeing much of the world and paying many of the expenses out of her pocket.

title: Excerpts From President Carter's Message to Congress on State of the Economy
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20  Following are excerpts from President Carter's economic message to Congress:

title: Kitanoumi Sumo Victor
description: TOKYO, Jan. 20 (UPI)Yokozuna Kitanoumi, a Grand Champion, beat Ozeki Wakamisugi, a Champion, in a close hout today and registered his 13th straight victory on the 13th da of the 15day New Year Grand sumo tournament. The 24yearold Kitanounii was to heavy for the champion to push out of the ring. Wakamisugi said after his second defat against 11 victories at the Koxugikan Sumo arena.

title: Leclerc Ordered Jailed On Suspicion of Fraud Involving Geneva Bank
description: GENEVA, Jan. 20The central figure in one of the banking scandals that rocked Switzerland last year was jailed here late yesterday on suspicion of fraud.

title: Miracle Saves Tugboat DiveBombed By Mistake and Struck by 2 of 3 Bombs
description: Mister, it's a miracle, Chief warrant Officer Daniel Barrs said yesterday as he told how the 79 officers and men of the United States Navy tug Cree escaped death or injury when a live 500pound bomb hit the tug instead of its practice target eight miles away.

title: Carter Economic Message Asks Voluntary Price and Wage Brake
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20  President Carter announced today what could be a more rigorous program to decelerate wage and price increases as part of a broad range of actions to improve the health and fairness of the economy.

title: Revival of Herbert Operetta
description: The Light Opera of Manhattan has come up with a winning revival of Victor Herbert's Mlle. Modiste, which must be one of that composer's pleasantest confections. Created in 1905 as a vehicle for Fritzi Scheff, a sprightly Metropolitan Opera soprano, it was a big success. It was seen as late as 1929 in New York and as late as 1952 in St. Louis, but one might have expected it to have greater currency because it has so much charm.

title: Recount Reaffirms Abzug Candidacy
description: Bella S. Abzug's narrow victory for the Democratic nomination in the East Side's 18th Congressional District was reaffirmed last night after a courtordered recount made at the request of her opponent, Carter Burden.

title: $1.7 Million Repaid Pension Fund By Trucking Concern Cited by U.S.,
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 (AP)The Labor Department reported today that a North Carolina trucking concern had paid back $1.7 million to its employee pension plan, the largest single amount recovered by the department under the Federal pension law.

title: U.S. Rabbi Tells of Talk With Sadat
description: A week before President Anwar elSadat of Egypt withdrew his Foreign Minister from political talks in Jerusalem, he told an American Jewish leader that he felt his peace initiative slipping away but that he had done everything possible to fulfill his sacred mission.

title: Personal Investing
description: The ripple effect of rising longterm interest rates has eddied almost everywherefrom Government and Federal agency bonds to prime rated corporates and even such ordinarily quiet financial backwaters as closedend bond funds.
