title: Transfers Transforming St. Francis
description: Lou Rossini, the St. Francis basketball coach, was sitting in his office, a cinderblock cubby hole strewn with basketball magazines and hightop sneakers. He was nursing a thick cigar as he told of a telephone conversation he had just finished.

title: A Pittance of Aid
description: In a eulogy to Hubert Humphrey, President Carter opened a window into his own heart on an issue close to the heart of the Minnesota Senator. He didn't see foreign aid as a giveaway, the President said. He didn't see foreign aid as billions of dollars going from our nation to others. He saw human needs. He saw foreign aid as a great investmentfrom a rich nation, pittance almost compared to what we earn and havethat builds up a wellspring of friendship between us and those hungry people.

description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 30One of those clouds no bigger than a man's hand has grown to thunderhead proportions and involved Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. in a controversy over the dismissal of a highlevel state employee.

title: HENRI GLINEUR
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 30 (AP)Henri Glineur, who founded the Belgian Communist Party and was expelled 42 years later, in 1963, because he was pro-Chinese, has died at the age of 78, party sources announced today. He founded the. party in 1921, but it never got big enough to play a significant role in politics. It now has two members in the House of Representatives and one in the Senate.

Ariz., where he had been living for the last 20 years.

title: Life Term Given in Drug Case

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30A skeptical Ways and Means Committee expressed doubts about many aspects of the Administration's ttax program ttoday out did so in restrained tones that showed no sign Yet of hardcore opposition.

In Sunday night's performance of George Rochberg's Song in Praise of Krishna (1970) at Carnegie Recital Hall, the opposite was true: The performance, by the soprano Neva Pilgrim and the pianist Dennis Helmrich, was better than the music.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan 30. (AP)Nearly 150 years after it first appeared in Ohio and Indiana, hog cholera has been eradicated from the Uinted States.

description: OTTAWA, Jan. 30Canadian and United States scientists announced today that a twisted cylindrical metal object discovered in northern Canada had been positively identified as part of the Soviet spy satellite that broke up over the area last Tuesday.

description: A witness at a Manhattan bribery trial yesterday testified that'former Governor Malcolm Wilson had promised contractors who gave $35,000 to his, campaign that he would see what I can do to settle their $21 million claim against the state.

title: Having It Both Ways on Marston
description: Two statements stand out from all of President Carter's stubborn reiterations yesterday that there has been no impropriety at all in the Administration's removal of David Marston, the Republican United States Attorney in Philadelphia. They do not show impropriety but they reflect a disturbing desire by the President to have things both ways.

title: MartinSheen Alters View On Violence
description: When Martin Sheen appears in Taxi!!!, a onehour television special to be shown Thursday on NBC at 10 P.M., he won't be killing or maiming or even leering, although he has been givenon. the screen, at leastto such antisocial behavior in the past. This time, Mr. Sheen will just drive, from a midtown Manhattan hotel to Kennedy International Airport. His passenger, a wealthy and restless matron, will be played by Eva Marie Saint, and during their hourlong conversation the matron and the taxi driver will profoundly influence and perhaps even alter each others lives.

title: Revision of Federal Criminal Code Is Adopted by the Senate, 72 to 15
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30The Senate tonight voted to abolish parole for Federal prisoners in almost all cases, in an overwhelming approval of the first comprehensive revision of Federal criminal laws in the history of those laws.

title: Robbery Conviction Poses Questions on Evidence
description: It was New York City's biggest bank robbery of the decade. In less than 10 minutes a lone holdup man, apparently with inside knowledge of the bank's operations, escaped with $279,000 from a Chemical Bank.branch in the Sheepshead Bay section of Brooklyn.

description: Larry MacPhail, the impresario who introduced night baseball into the major leaLlues, and. Addie Joss, a celebrated pitcher from the turn of the century, were elected to the Baseball Hall o  Fame yesterday.

description: ALBANY, Jan. 30The fierce attempt by supporters of Perry B. Duryea to shift this year's gubernatorial primary election from September to June was blocked this evening by Senate Republicans uniting behind their majority leader, Warren M. Anderson.

description: Buoyed by better-than-expected figures for the United States trade deficit, stock prices rallied briskly yesterday on continued low volume.

title: The Swastika as Free Speech
description: Nazis may march in Skokie and display swastikas. So says the highest court of Illinois in a decision that at once sensitive to the feelings of the residents of the lareelv Jewish town and respectful of the.Constitution. It will not satisfy those who argue, plausibly, that parade by such a group in such a town is an incitement to violence, or that the Nazi symbol should be considered fighting words and so be exempt from the First Amendment guarantee of free speech. That argument is now being weighed in a separate case in Federal court, and may reach the United States Supreme Court.

title: H. Walter Riland, Former Officer. Of Bedford Y.M.C.A. in Brooklyn

title: Siberian Oil Center (Pop. 80,000) a Far Cry From U.S. Boom Town

It would be flavored with a neonlit strip of bars, an array of good restaurants, a plethora of wellstocked stores and plenty of young women plying, their trade in the world's oldest profession.

title: A MEXICAN ARMS REQUEST PUTS U.S. POLICY TO TEST
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30  President Carter's policy of trying to reduce worldwide sales of sophisticated weapons, especially to developing countries, has been put to an embarrassing test with a request from Mexico for jet aircraft worth $150 million.

title: Fair Rules for an Unfair Abortion Law
description: Health, Education and Welfare Secretary Califano has done his duty; He has interpreted the nation's unfair abortion law fairly. The recently issued regulations will continue to discriminate against the poor by strictly limiting their access to Medicaid abortion funds. But this misguided social policy is the creation- of a misguided Congress, not of the Secretary. On several controversial issues Mr. Califano and his lawyers have performed admirably, hacking their way through a thicket of ambiguities in the law that passed a bitter and divided Congress in December, after months of heated debate.

description: New Jersey has begun an intensive drive against the illegal dumping of toxic chemical industrial wastes, but it has not been able to find adequate legal disposal facilities.

description: Steel production for the week ended Jan. 28 fell to 2.22 million tons, down 5.9 percent from the week before, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. The industry produced 2.36 million tons the week before.

description: Heading confidently into the Treasury's $6.7 billion financing this week, the credit markets yesterday moved moderately higher in price and lower in yield as traders predicted substantial demand for the new securities scheduled for sale.

title: SOMOZA ACTS SECURE AS STRIKE CONTINUES; Nicaraguan Says End of Protest Is Just .a Matter of TimeFoes Express Confidence
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Jan. 30A nationwide strike aimed at forcing the resignation of Nicaragua's longruling President, Gen. Anastasio Somoza Debayle, entered its second week today with no sign that he was about to give up power.

title: 2 Bombs Explode; Window Broken At Con Ed Office
description: Two separate explosions in the Gramercy Park area, apparently caused by pipe bombs, blew out a window at Consolidated Edison office and did slight damage to an empty police car early this morning.

Webster of the Federal appellate court navigated skillfully today through Senate confirmation hearings for Director of the Federal BureaU ofInvestigation, noting that he. had no plans to resign abruptly from fotir allwhite St. Louis social clubs and voicing support of recent F.B.I. changes in its techniques.

He squeezed off five rounds in a thorough arc of fury, moving so fast it would have taken the cameraman from The Wild Bunch to record ail.

title: Recital Group Plays Works Of 2Moderns
description: In 1963 when both Paul Hindemith and Francis Poulenc died, it was the former whose claim to lasting importance seemed greater. Performances of his works were not only frequent but also difficult to avoid, and his reputation as one of the foremost intellects of contemporary music made him a formidable figure. Poulenc, on the other hind, was not taken quite so seriously; in fact, he was offen dismissed as a Gallic trifler.

title: Notes on People
description: The $97,500, Templeton Prize for Progress in. Religion was awarded yesterday to Thomas Torrance, a Scottish Presbyterian Who has been credited with advancing theology into the nuclear age. The .annual award, estab, lished by John M. Templeton, an American millionaire, Is the most lucrative in the field of religion. It w as given Mr. Torrance, a professor of Christian dogmatics at the University of Edinburgh and at New College in Edinburgh, for exercising immense influence through his understanding of the most fundamental scientific concepts, establishing a basis for the union of science and theology. He said, I feel rather staggered, stunried and humbled at being awarded the prize.

title: 17 NEW YORK COUNTIES REDUCE PROPERTY TAX
description: ALBANY, Jan. 30County property taxes across New York State are going down in a littlenoticed turn of events that could reduce pressure on the Legislature for more aid to the counties.

title: Corporation Affairs Sears Set to Market and Install Pay TV in the Los Angeles Area
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 30 (AP)Sears, Roebuck & Company, the nation's largest retailer, is entering the pay-television industry in the Los Angeles area, company spokesmen said today.
